product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
consumer_complaint_narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX I received a letter from the IRS stating my identity may have been compromised. My name is XXXX XXXX and I was XXXX yrs old at the time and a college student. My mom & I sat down as I returned from college and pulled my credit report. Discovered after pulling the Free Annual Credit Report that another person, XXXX XXXX  XXXX, and a car loan & credit card that were not mine were on my credit report. It should be noted it was only on XXXX. We contacted XXXX & Wells Fargo bank to report the fraudulent accounts. They did confirm it was my SS # on file but with someone elses name, DOB, and address. We filled out fraud forms, send police report number, and copies of credit reports. On XX/XX/XXXX & XX/XX/XXXX I received letters from both Wells Fargo & XXXX stating it was discovered to be identity theft and they would have the 3 credit bureaus remove from my credit file. I also placed a freeze on my credit files. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I received a few voicemails from SS office stating my identity may have been compromised yet again. I pulled credit reports again and was shocked to see XXXX  is reporting my file as XXXX XXXX XXXX, his DOB, Addresses, XXXX XXXX is running inquiries ( I dont have ), Wells Fargo credit card is showing closed as of XX/XX/XXXX, last payment XX/XX/XXXX, shows consumer disputes, and last reported XX/XX/XXXX. None of this is mine and was to be removed. 

This person is clearly using my SS # according to XXXX & Wells Fargo. XXXX did their job and removed it for Fraud. Wells Fargo has not. How did a large national bank such as Wells Fargo allow someone to open a credit card in my name without the proper verification. Clearly the other persons name and DOB ( XX/XX/XXXX ) does not match my SS #. Where is the verification on that? They allowed someone to use falsified documents and did not follow verification procedures. I am only XXXX yrs old and have been a victim of identity theft by 2 large companies. Please help me with getting this resolved so myself and others never have this happen again.
company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

The banking clerk told me that she cant open for me regular account because of my bad credit history, she opened for my opportunity ( limited ) checking account and suggest to check all my information within a credit bureaus. I physically lived in XXXX-it 's no way for me to used this card. I called Disvover fraud department and told all this information above, but they still didnt report to credit bureaus to remove this fraud account from my credit report.

consumer_complaint_narrative:
I am filing this complaint after receiving a letter from Chase today alleging a lie to cover up their illegal activities. In the letter ( see attachment ) dated XX/XX/XXXX Chase asserted that we cant consider you for mortgage assistance because we didnt receive your initial request by the required number of days before the scheduled foreclosure date. THIS STATEMENT IS A LIE. I REPEAT. THIS STATEMENT IS A LIE, AND I CAN PROVE IT! 
Chase has repeatedly made false allegations like this to us for more than four years. Most of the Chase Request for Mortgage Assistance applications we have sent to Chase have been ignored ( see attachment ). Nonetheless, In XX/XX/XXXX, our Chase dedicated relationship manager in XXXX, Florida spoke to the Chase branch bank manager and vice president in XXXX, Georgia. He ( the vice president ) told her ( our dedicated relationship manager ) that he personally faxed all of our documents to her the previous week and confirmed their receipt in her office at that time. In spite of this fact, she requested through the branch bank vice president that we submit our application and all required documents to her again for the 33rd time in 18 months ( see attachment ). Consequently, our dedicated relationship manager sent to our home address a XXXX envelope for us to submit our application and documents back to her again. We sealed the documents in that envelope and took it back to the Chase branch bank so that Chase employees could send it to her through XXXX. 
The Chase branch bank in XXXX, Georgia took receipt of our envelope of documents and gave them to XXXX. XXXX tracking confirms that our application was received by our dedicated relationship manager in her actual office on XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX XXXX ( see attachment ). After that date, we never heard from our dedicated relationship manager again regarding ANY aspect of our application. 
Chase proceeded in XXXX to schedule a foreclosure on our property for XX/XX/XXXX in violation of the laws of our state for multiple reasons, including failure to provide proper notification as required by law. As such, this proves the statement made by Chase to us in their letter dated XX/XX/XXXX is a lie because we submitted our Request for Mortgage Assistance application to Chase more than thirty days before Chase took illegal action to attempt a foreclosure on the date of XX/XX/XXXX. Our " dedicated relationship manager '' failed to process our application despite our having previously submitted it to her in XX/XX/XXXX, and well as on 32 previous occasions in the past 18 months.
company_public_response: NA

issue: Advertising and marketing, including promotional offers
sub_issue: Didn't receive advertised or promotional terms
consumer_complaint_narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I went to XXXX XXXX & XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX NY to look at appliances for my new apartment. Salesperson XXXX XXXX assisted me. I had planned to use my credit card to make the purchase but Mr. XXXX encouraged me to take out the store credit card through Synchrony Bank and I would be given a promotional sale which is 18 months interest free to pay off my purchase. I credited {$3500.00} worth of appliances that day and he calculated my monthly payments as {$190.00}. I paid {$200.00} every month up until XX/XX/2018. In XX/XX/XXXX to my surprise I received an email from Synchrony Bank saying that the promotion would expire XX/XX/XXXX. I then made numerous calls to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and was given the runaround. They put me on hold numerous times and then mysteriously the call was dropped. On one occasion they said that the manager was busy and would return my call. He never did. When I called back they told that the manager was still busy and I should call Synchrony Bank instead because they could not help me. The salesperson Mr. XXXX was always conveniently not at work to take my calls. 
I called Synchrony Bank and they told me that they had nothing to do with the promotional sale and that XXXX XXXX are responsible. I was caught between a rock and a hard place as no one wanted to take responsibility and rectify the problem. I balance of approximately {$1100.00} became almost {$1700.00} and when I paid monthly interest was again added monthly. In order to preserve my good credit I had to transfer funds from another credit card with a lower interest rate to pay off this never ending balance.
company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

consumer_complaint_narrative:
Capital One mailed me a closeout check on or around XX/XX/XXXX, received on XX/XX/XXXX, deposited to my XXXX XXXX account on XX/XX/XXXX. Capital One chose to place a stop payment prematurely on the check and in error, they will not admit to this error plainly, will rather state " Expectations not set correctly '' as reason for stop payment. A second check was expedited via XXXX second day air and rep ( s ) did not allow enough mail time for prior check before reissuing and thus stopping payment.. The check amount, XXXX, represents the remaining balance in my checking account ending in XXXX. Replacement check was sent on XX/XX/XXXX and delivered on XX/XX/XXXX. I left for XXXX XXXX on this day, was not at my address to receive/sign for it or sign check itself. 

XXXX XXXX with XXXX XXXX XXXX picked me up, drove me to XXXX XXXX XXXX at XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. I have a statement from Mr XXXX stating he picked me up on said date and time. Please see attached document from Mr XXXX, he can be reached at XXXX. I was in XXXX XXXX from XX/XX/XXXX to XXXX. 

I received information from a XXXX with leadership team at Capital One stating said check was intercepted and signed by a XXXX XXXX whom does not live here, cashed at a XXXX XXXX XXXX which is not my account and do not bank there. A XXXX XXXX with Capital One has replied in re about this, stating the person, XXXX XXXX, lives at my address and the XXXX XXXX Bank account is or was linked to my Capital One account at some point. She also refers to a check deposited to my account from this person sometime ago. My account is now closed and It appears Capital One chose to close it due to account security, they saw the linked account, which I am not aware of, as a possible risk. It appears someone had hacked into my account at some point, added XXXX XXXX account and also used my account to cash a check in the past. Neither of these two incidents are related to loss of funds or constitute receipt of them. 

If Capital One will check signatures on check received on XX/XX/XXXX and replacement check delivered on XX/XX/XXXX, they will see signatures are different from another. Also, another check from Capital One covering overdraft and return check fees relating to stop payment shows my true and correct signature, as does the check received on XX/XX/XXXX which was deposited to my XXXX account and is now closed due to overdrawn status. The overdraft is a result of Capital One stopping payment prematurely as stated prior. I've requested Capital One check signatures, XXXX XXXX did not comply. For argument sake and figuratively speaking even if the person, XXXX XXXX, is related, does not mean funds were not stolen from me as they in fact were..

I request someone in office of the President look into this matter which has been ongoing since late XX/XX/XXXX/early XX/XX/XXXX. To avoid investigating signatures as requested, Capital One chooses to mark complaints as duplicate to avoid doing so. They requested additional time to reply to a prior complaint, which took over a month and then turned around, marked it as duplicate.

consumer_complaint_narrative:
I was stupid enough to charge some items at MACY 'S on my Macy 's credit card over XXXX. I was unable to log into my account online to make the payment because Macy 's had updated the system and I simply did n't have the patience to navigate their irritating and obscure system. However, I called Macy 's and paid my bill for $ XXXX a day or two late - was assured that there would be no late charges because I was a customer in good standing, yada yada, and received a confirmation number that I had paid the bill in full. 

I then received a bill for {$2.00} in interest. OK, I agree - I had n't paid the {$140.00} on time, regardless of the reason. Whatever. So I paid that {$2.00} bill immediately, by check, and left the country for an extended absence - in complete confidence that I had paid all my bills in full. 

Imagine my surprise when I returned to the US and found that Macy 's had received and cashed my check, but charged me a further {$2.00} anyway as a minimum interest charge on the interest charge that had been paid in full, well before the due date. Oh, and then added a further minimum {$2.00} charge for a total of {$4.00}, due on XXXX. 

I called Macy 's right away and spoke to one XXXX, who did n't seem to have a clue why I was irritated, but eventually - very grudgingly and with full implication that I was a total deadbeat - agreed that she would " waive '' the {$4.00}. 

Imagine my FURTHER surprise when I received a FURTHER email from Macy 's about my " account balance. '' I immediately called, went through endless voice prompts, and finally got through to a live human being who said in hushed tones that she 'd have to put me through to another department. 

Sure enough, I got the " this is an attempt to collect a debt '' speech. The glorious XXXX, according to the faultlessly polite CS rep who answered, had failed to properly credit my account. He agreed that he could correct it and that my account would update eventually to show a {$0.00} balance. However, he was unable to reassure me that this, um, " delinquency '' had not been reported to the credit bureaux that make a darn good living off selling my info, and he could not send me a letter saying that Macy 's had made a mistake. Given that the glorious XXXX had also assured me that I had a {$0.00} balance on my Macy 's charge card, forgive me if I 'm not confident that I do in fact now have a {$0.00} balance. 

I do not give a flying whatever about my credit as I am old and cranky and do n't need any credit. I DO care that Macy 's total incompetence and the Macy 's system that is set up to fail, to their benefit and to consumers ' detriment, affects kids and other people who DO need good credit.
company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
consumer_complaint_narrative:
In XX/XX/2018 for about 10 months I made my daughter an authorized user of my account. Before doing so Barclay Card assured me that she could be a user and that it would have no impact on her credit. Only I was responsible for all charges on the account. She never signed anything. I asked for her to be added as an authorized signer to my account. BarclayCard sent her a card of her own to use. About XX/XX/XXXX she was finished with her need to use my credit card and I removed her as a user. 

She went to check her credit bureau the other day and found Barclay Card to be reporting MY full balance to her credit report. She called Barclay Card and they said they could not talk with her about it since she is not a signer on the account. I called Barclay Card to have it corrected and they said that I had to submit letter, via regular mail, and all of the supporting documentation to have my daughters credit reporting reversed. 

Their fraudulent mistake is not my problem to fix. Barclay Card acknowledges that they should not be reporting on my daughters credit report. They should not have reported it to her credit bureau while she was using the card and they certainly should not be reporting it now. However, they said they will maintain the fraudulent reporting unless I write them a letter with all the required documentation to have it removed. 

This is the exact kind of bullying behavior a big bank is supposed to have stopped a long time ago. So they have made an error and now it is MY problem to fix it. Unacceptable. And Illegal. 

Barclay Card has my complaint and my daughter 's complaint by phone and now through this correspondence. If they do not correct the erroneous reporting in a reasonable amount of time I will be forced to take more serious actions regarding the fraud they have committed against my daughter. Not to mention the illegal release of information about my account to her ( she should have never known the balance of my card at anytime, ever ). 

In my conversation with two Barclay representatives on the phone this evening both confirmed that the reporting should not have occurred as she was merely an authorized user with no responsibility for the credit and that the only way I can correct a credit reporting error, even if it is completely their fault, is in writing to a mailing address with supporting documentation which includes my daughter sending them, by mail, a full copy of the erroneous credit reporting. That exposes my family to unnecessary risk. The credit report they want me to send through the mail has all types of personally identifiable information contained within it.
company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

On a letter dated XX/XX/XXXX Chase states they are still working on my billing dispute for XXXX from the XXXX XXXX for {$410.00} on XX/XX/XXXX. It has been over 10 months since the date I initially brought up the billing error to their attention. This is way past the timeframe allowed to investigate and correct any billing errors. I provided Chase with an email from the hotel prior to check in which verifies my lower rate being honored, a copy of the lowest rate and a copy of the hotel 's low rate guarantee. Despite the hotel verifying my lower rate in writing they still charged me 5x the agreed upon rate which was changed after I checked out. I never agreed to, authorized or had any knowledge of the increased rate until after I had left the property. 

Despite the overwhelming evidence validating this to indeed be a billing error Chase has still taken 10 months and counting to correct it. This violated the Fair Billing Practices Act.
company_public_response: NA

consumer_complaint_narrative: Capital 1 bank had an offer " Deposit {$50000.00} or more to a new Capital 1 365 money market account and maintain at least {$50000.00} daily balance for 90 days to get {$500.00} bonus '' last summer. I opened an account online on XX/XX/19 and transferred {$50000.00} from my external bank to Capital 1 bank on XX/XX/19. I kept my daily balance above {$50000.00} until XX/XX/19. On XX/XX/19, I transferred some money out. I thought I already passed 90 day requirement. In XX/XX/XXXX., I contacted Capital 1 to check the bonus status. Surprisingly I was told that I was 1 day short of requirement. Based on their explanation, I have to deposit within 10 days of account opening. Then I have to maintain a daily balance of {$50000.00} or more for 90 days following the initial funding period, which is 10 days. So even I have kept my daily balance above {$50000.00} longer than 90 days, I am not qualified for {$500.00} bonus. I went back to read the fine print carefully for this promotion. It states that " Deposit {$50000.00} or more of new money from an external bank within the first 10 days of account opening. You will earn the {$500.00} bonus once youve maintained a daily balance of {$50000.00} or more for the first 90 days following the Initial Funding Period ''. It did not clearly and specifically pointed out that the initial funding period is TEN days, regardless when you funded account after opening it. I thought funding period referred to the time between opening account and funding account, as long as it is no more than 10 days. If I funded my new account on the 10th day of account opening and kept the daily minimum balance requirement for 90 days, I would have qualified for the bonus. In my case, I funded my new account on the 3rd day of account opening and kept the daily minimum balance requirement for 97 days, I am not qualified for bonus. The fine print words are very ambiguous and confusing. If it made it clear at the first place, I would have kept {$50000.00} for longer time. I hope Capital 1 Bank can reconsider my case and issue the bonus that I deserve. Thank you very much for your help!
company_public_response: NA

consumer_complaint_narrative: I am a victim of a school loan consolidation scam. A company conned me into allowing them to remove {$29.00} on the XXXX of each month, a recurring transaction stating that the money would be paid toward my student loans. The money has been taken out of my Wells Fargo Checking Account religiously for years. In XX/XX/2018 I entered a branch of Wells Fargo, after learning that the school loan consolidation company was a scam, and filed a fraudulent claim. Going back the life of the authorization and was told that the Fraud Department would be in contact but I was assured that the withdrawal of funds would stop, per my revoking the authorization. I was contacted in XX/XX/XXXX by the Wells Fargo Fraud Department and was told that they found my authorization for recurring withdrawals to be sufficient and denied my fraudulent claim. Even with me supplying proof that the company listed as taking the funds out was reported by the XXXX  as being out of business and was a fraudulent company. At which point I notified the representative from the Wells Fargo Fraud Department and the branch I originally went into of my rights to 'revoke ' any previously authorized recurring withdrawals, stating I wanted an immediate seizure of any future withdrawals and requested that the withdrawn funds for XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX be refunded. Please be advised that this all took place before the XX/XX/XXXX withdrawal was to take place as well as the withdrawal for XX/XX/XXXX which was also removed.. However, the withdrawal for XX/XX/XXXX did take place and nothing has been refunded. In fact, Wells Fargo has informed me that I am not permitted to stop this withdrawal from recurring even with the revocation of my original approval. Attached please find the letter I sent to the Fraud Department and the Branch itself.

consumer_complaint_narrative:
I bought a watch on XXXX  that was supposed to look like a XXXX  but with no branding. It was supposed to be two watches. I received the package from some random country in the XXXX XXXX. It contained only ONE ( 1 ) watch, which was a poor, cheap, extremley bad XXXX  branded replica watch. product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
consumer_complaint_narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX I received a letter from chase stating that they are reporting my Home Equity Line of Credit ( HELOC ) as charged off on XX/XX/XXXX with unpaid balance of {$24000.00}.

They stated they canceled the balance owed on XX/XX/XXXX and issued a XXXX. and as a result updated charge off balance to {$0.00} on XX/XX/XXXX and reported to credit bureaus on XX/XX/XXXX.

Further they state they carefully reviewed the account and did not find any misrepresentations, unfair tactics or tried to be deceiving.

And that they are required to report accurately.

The problem with these statements are my credit report shows a charge off in the payment history on XX/XX/XXXX. Then the next data entry shows a charge off on XX/XX/XXXX.

The status shows a balance update and status of charge off update to be XX/XX/XXXX when they clearly said in the letter the balance was canceled on XX/XX/XXXX. If the balance is {$0.00} on XX/XX/XXXX it should state XX/XX/XXXX not XX/XX/XXXX.

The next problem is the XXXX they furnished in the letter and sent to the irs shows an identifiable event code of ( F ) By Agreement. This would have to mean that I made an agreement with them to cancel the debt owed for less than the full balance. This would be false.

The date of the Identifiable event is XX/XX/XXXX. Considering the Irs regulations prior to XX/XX/XXXX. If a debt has not been paid for 36 months and active collection is not pursued then a XXXX is to be issued even if the debt is not discharged. The account was delinquent prior to XX/XX/XXXX and closed and charged off XX/XX/XXXX. A XXXX should have been issued prior to XX/XX/XXXX. So in this case the XXXX was issued in the wrong year with incorrect event coding Finally according to XXXX  county land records there was a mortgage assignment filed for this account. The Assignment of mortgage was not to Chase Home Finance nor Chase Home Lending. Which gives reason to believe the incorrect creditor is reporting the debt and that they do not have a valid claim. Whether the Assignment of mortgage is valid is speculative considering the notary had been suspended and the agent on behalf of Chase may or may not have worked for Chase.

My actions have been contacting Chase about the misrepresentations and they have stated the account has been charged off since XX/XX/XXXXbut it is still open and they are reporting correctly.

I disputed with Credit Reporting Agencies to validate the information which is clearly incorrect. The came back that they only report what they are told to and that it was validated.

I have submitted a prior complaint to CFPB which contacted Chase which responded with the letter that I have explained.

I have continually ran into problems getting credit due to this account reporting the charge off as XX/XX/XXXX since Derogatory Credit waiting periods require 4 years though the Charge Off had occurred XX/XX/XXXX. The cancellation of debt was XX/XX/XXXX which is not a charge off especially if the account was already charged off.

consumer_complaint_narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX, I visited XXXX XXXX of XXXX XXXX, VA. I was softly in the market for a new car. I found a vehicle I was interested in, and a salesman pressured me into seeing if I could get approved for financing. I live on a fixed, SSI XXXX income so I was concerned about over-extending myself. They got me approved for financing, but I was still skeptical due to the high monthly payments. It was a Saturday, so the salesmen told me I could take the care home and see how I liked it. By Sunday morning, I knew this was something that I didn't want to do. First thing Monday morning ( the XXXX ), I returned the vehicle to XXXX XXXX. The manager and salesmen were very angry with me, and told me I had to take the car. I told them that I had the right of rescission, and was well within my rights to return the vehicle and change my mind. After all, because it was the weekend, the paperwork had not even been sent to the finance company yet. I left the vehicle at the dealership in their possession. I assumed the issue was resolved at that point. Over the next several days, I was overwhelmed with phone calls from reps at XXXX XXXX   saying that I had to come back to the dealership and pick up the car. I held steadfast, and told them that I had changed my mind, and did not want it. I had returned the car to the dealership within 36 hours and was well within my rights to do so. Again, I believe the issue to be resolved. To my surprise, the dealership actually delivered their car to my house on XX/XX/XXXX. I called the sheriff 's office about this, and asked them what I should do. They told me I should just take it back again, if I did not want it ; and that's what I did. I returned the vehicle again ( that same day ) and left it in their possession. Again, I thought the issue was resolved. Recently, I received a letter from a finance company called Santander talking about my interest rate on a car loan. I had no idea what this was about. I called them, and sure enough, this was for the car from XXXX XXXX. I explained the whole situation with the rep at the finance company, and they said they would make sure it was resolved. So despite returning the vehicle to the dealership before they even submitted the finance paperwork, and them knowing I did not want the car, the submitted the financing paperwork anyway. I can't believe the lengths that this dealership would go to try to force someone to buy a car they clearly did not want.
company_public_response: NA

issue: Problem caused by your funds being low
consumer_complaint_narrative:
In 2016, I was charged over {$1700.00} in overdraft charges after chase bank removed my access to mobile bank deposits. I have recorded conversations with bank employees, recorded with their consent, explicitly stating that the feature was removed due to low funding levels in my account, though no official guidelines were ever presented to me, despite multiple requests. My complaint is split into two parts : 1. ) Chase Bank utilized predatory tactics to remove mobile deposit from consumers who would most benefit from the feature. I was forced to incur heavy overdraft fees, many of which were returned when bank employees agreed that fees were caused exclusively due to the removal of that feature. After multiple instances when the bank agreed with my complaints and reversed fees, they continued agreeing but no longer had the capacity to reverse the charges. In one instance, when the city of XXXX was completely flooded and no street access existed to banks or atms, I was still charged a fee, even when I showed the ability to make a deposit as soon as the streets became accessible. Instances such as this occurred on numerous occasions, and each time employees told me that my feature had been removed due to a history of overdrafts, which was entirely created as a result of the removal, itself. This policy of removing the feature for customers with low or negative balances puts us into a purposeful loop of overdraft fees, which bank employees acknowledged as a known problem. 

2. ) I asked on numerous occasions to be given written or formal guidelines about my rights, as a consumer to utilize the mobile deposit feature. While in my recordings bank employees give vastly different answers about the terms of use, none could provide me with clear written rules. Who qualifies for that feature? When will mine be turned on? Why was the feature removed as a result of overdraft fees? All indicated that the feature was removed due to low funds or overdrafts, but none could explain why removal came as a consequence of those facts. Several employees agreed that this was an unfair practice and indicated that numerous customers called in with similar complaints over time. The second portion of my complaint is thus about the bank 's lack of transparency about customer terms of use. 

My recorded conversations with employees are from XX/XX/16, XX/XX/16, XX/XX/2016, XX/XX/16, XX/XX/16, XX/XX/16, and XX/XX/16. In total, throughout that period I was assessed {$1700.00} in fees, though {$500.00} were refunded by employees who agreed that I had done all I could to avoid them.
company_public_response: NA

issue: Problem caused by your funds being low
consumer_complaint_narrative:
In early XXXX, I ran into some financial trouble because my PNC bank account did not update on mobile banking over XXXX XXXX. This overdrew my account on the following Tuesday and because I was out of town and not working at the time, I had to wait 2 weeks for a paycheck to bring my account back to balance. I accrued over a XXXX dollars in overdraft and NSF fees and have records to prove this. I called PNC multiple times and asked of anything could be done to stop this with zero help. I was transferred to a supervisor department after the 1st employees claimed they could not reverse any of the fees as the system would not let them. The phone rang once and I got an automated message that said no one was available and the call automatically ended. Never called back. Accepting that they would not budge to work with me or help me at all, I paid the fees and brought my account back to positive and moved on. 

Fast forward to today. The company I work for has decided to switch to biweekly pay instead of weekly. These past 2 weeks on one weeks pay have been awful and stressful. However, we managed to make it to Thursday XX/XX/19 without overdrawing. My account was negative XXXX dollars on Thursday XX/XX/19. When I woke up on Friday XX/XX/19 my account was negative XXXX because of a few small transactions that went through and XXXX dollars in overdraft fees 3 XXXX  dollar charges each. So, my paycheck finally hit the account for XXXX dollars on Friday XX/XX/19. Then at XXXX on Saturday XX/XX/19 I was charged 3 more XXXX dollar overdraft fees after my paycheck had already hit the account. Because my paycheck has gone through I did not expect this. I have so many bills coming out this week from having to wait 2 weeks to get paid, that I can not afford XXXX dollars in overdraft fees. This is my whole grocery budget for the next 2 weeks until I get paid again and I literally have no food in my apartment. I called again today XX/XX/19 asking for assistance in this especially because my paycheck had hit and there is no reason for the fees to be met with no help again and told I should use tips to avoid overdrafting. Enough is enough of this. Ive paid so much in overdraft fees that I can't afford to live. All I want was the 3 most recent overdraft fees refunded to me so I can afford groceries so I don't starve without over drafting again and having the same thing happen while I wait another 2 weeks to get paid. I have exhausted all options to avoid this. I have overdraft protection on my account. I have alerts sent to me when my account drops below XXXX dollars. The way PNC does their business makes it impossible to avoid this because it happens over night while you are sleeping and then to offer no solution to a good, 6 year customer is frustrating and disheartening.

consumer_complaint_narrative:
On XX/XX/2019 XXXX XXXX  notified me by email ( see attachments ) that my loan was being sold ( transferred ) to M & T Bank as of XX/XX/2019. I did not ask for this to happen, neither did I want to do business with M & T Bank, although I realized the sale was legal. 

The email notice said that I " would not have to change any of the terms '' of my payments and simply continue as I had been doing, the only change being payments made to M & T Bank rather than XXXX. On Friday, XX/XX/2019, I received a 2nd email notice from M & T Bank basically stating the exact same thing. 

For the last 5 or more years, I had been making my XXXX XXXX payments through my XXXX XXXX Bill Payment System ( see attachments ). Payments were being made at least twice a month or every two ( 2 ) weeks consistently. I have NEVER made payments late in over 10 years with any mortgage payment and usually make the 2nd payment in a month ( prior month to due date ) at least 1 to 3 days early. My wife and I earn over {$180000.00} per year and do not have any issues making any debt payment!

At the time the transfer became effective, I had already paid XXXX XXXX  for the month of XXXX as I always due before the end of the previous month. M & T Bank sent me a bill not giving me credit for XX/XX/2019 payments that had already been made to XXXX XXXX prior to the transfer. Secondly, since I thought this was an error, I waited for a corrected statement. Instead, I received a pass due notice when my XXXX payment was not even due! 

I called M & T Bank on last Friday, XX/XX/2019 and explained everything above to the representative. Instead of assisting me with the issue, she kept giving me the run around and telling me that I had " to change the way I was paying by logging on and signing up for their every-two-week payment bank draft ''. This was a direct contradiction to what I had been guaranteed in writing that I would NOT have to change the way I had been paying my mortgage properly for years. Secondly, she did nothing to bring my mortgage account current as it should be. 

Lastly, I just received by mail another pass due notice stating that I owe {$2900.00}, when in fact, I OWE ABSOLUTELY NOTHING!!! The M & T Bank bill also included some {$920.00} " Hazard Disbursement '' amount, which has never appeared on any previous mortgage bill, and they never explained it to me. 

My payments are current, and documentation is attached to prove it! If I were not late with XXXX XXXX, how could I now be late with M & T Bank when I have continued to make all payments twice a month or even every two weeks right through their transfer of mortgage process, for which again, I did not ask nor desire? 

This is absolutely ridiculous, and I expect the federal government to take the strongest possible action against this bank. They did not even listen to me or even try to correct the situation. I have been a perfect customer, I always pay all bills on time ( my credit score proves that ), and I will not tolerate this harassment in the lease. 


Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX
company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

My wife and I placed an order for a mattress from Mattress Firm on XX/XX/19. The sales rep kept making odd steps and corrections so we repeatedly tried to confirm that the item he was ordering for us was the exact same item from the floor model. 

We made it abundantly clear that our purchase was strictly on the grounds that we were getting the exact item we wanted, and confirmed FOUR times that the item lined out on the order matched the floor model, as there was no other way to verify. We agreed to finance the purchase of that specific order and that specific order alone. 

Now, we found out that the sales rep pulled a bait and switch on us and ordered a different item from what we agreed upon. As such, the sales rep pulled credit to sell us an item that we had not agreed upon, and had we known about the bait and switch, we never would have authorized the credit pull.

sub_product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
consumer_complaint_narrative:
I am having some difficulties obtaining information regarding my 3 Capital One credit cards in " restricted status ''. 

I contacted the Capital One call center on XX/XX/2019 - the offshore representative said she would not obtain any details since it was with the Fraud Department but I was going to need to provide 3 documents for them to review. I was not willing to provide documents without more insight into what was happening or the issue being investigated. I asked to be transferred if a Supervisor but after waiting on hold for over 8 minutes -- I disconnected the call. 

I contacted the Capital One call center on XX/XX/2019 - I was routed through the auto-dialer to the Fraud Department. The representative was polite but unable to give me any detailed information about the status of my accounts. He explained I would need to provide a picture of my Oregon Driver 's License via a secure email link. Upon review, I would receive a phone call advising on the status of my accounts. I received the email, took 4 pictures of my ODL, and attached to the secured link and received a confirmation message indicating the transmission was successful. 

I contacted the Capital One call center on XX/XX/2019 - I was routed through the auto-dialer to the Fraud Department ( XXXX  ). I voiced my frustration about not receiving any status on the review nor a call as indicated by the XX/XX/2019 rep. XXXX advised no documents were received and provided a little more detail into possibilities of someone else attempting to retrieve or access my account. He did not or could not provide specifics. He sent me a new link to provide my documents and waiting on the call with me to confirm receipt. He was not able to confirm receipt since the documents again were not received. He was going to consult another party to confirm if there was a technical issue to explain why my documents were not being received. Then, the call disconnected. 

I can not begin to express to you how perplexing, concerning, and frustrating this has become to me as a long-standing Capital One customer. I may not have thousands of dollars of CC activity each year but I am definitely a customer who pays their bills and is paying monthly interest on my credit cards. I NEED someone to explain to me the specifics of the current restricted status of my accounts. I NEED someone to confirm receipt of my previous 2 submissions. I do not think it is too much to ask especially since it is MY personal information Capital One is requesting and asking me to compile without giving me any details. It is an odd way to do business and definitely lacks transparency. 

I noticed the restricted message on my Capital One mobile app when I was checking the status of my autopay. There has been no verbal or written outreach by Capital One to me to advise or inform about the status of my account either.

consumer_complaint_narrative:
A year ago, on XX/XX/2018, I went to a store to realize that my credit card didn't work. I called the Bank which was Chase and ask about it, the agent told me that all my credit cards from Chase were closed and that no information can be disclosed until I will receive a letter about it. 
I had 5 chase credit card, the Chase Business Ink, the Chase Sapphire Reserve, the Chase Freedom Unlimited, the Chase Hyatt Credit card, and the Chase Ihg credit card. In addition, my wife that was an authorized user on one of my cards, got her only card closed ( the Chase Sapphire Preferred card ). 
Chase claim was that I was requesting too many credit cards in a short time and that was a payment made from another company once. 
Although I had these 5 cards with Chase, they were open over a long period of time ( 4 years ) and they had different purposes. I always paid my bills on time and never had high spending on those cards. My incomes were high enough to justify all the credit limit I had. 
I did pay off once my balance with a check from a company, this was because I had a contract with them and some of my expenses that occurred during my work with them were paid with my personal credit card. It was normal to reimburse these expenses directly from the company 's check. 
I called Chase many time and spoke with many representatives but no one was able to help me with this. 
I'm reaching out to you to help me with that.
company_public_response: NA

consumer_complaint_narrative: On XX/XX/2018 I was involved in a scam.My XXXX account had wrong billing information so I called XXXX to resolve the issue. The lines were disconnected and i received a call back from an individual falsely identifying themselves as employees of XXXX. The individual then informed that my XXXX account was being hacked. He told me I needed to buy XXXX cards to contact the servers to fix the situation. After I got them, he told me that I was being hacked by XXXX servers and I needed to purchase " XXXX XXXX '' cards. I purchased some and they were telling me that some of the cards were working and others were not and that i needed to purchase more to have my phone unhacked. They were telling me that i was going to get a full refund because it was a problem that happy because of XXXX and XXXX. It really got out of hand and I didn't realize it could be a scam till one of the banks told me that these has been happening recently. I had no idea. These individuals were using tech jargon and giving ID numbers and phone numbers, I honestly should have known and I used poor judgment in this matter. A police report was filled.

consumer_complaint_narrative: When filing a chargeback legally the creditor must acknowledge your complaint, in writing, within 30 days after receiving it, unless the problem has been resolved. While Chase does send a letter for every chargeback submitted, they are far from letters acknowledging the dispute. Quite often the letters acknowledging the dispute have no information identifying which transaction or dispute they are actually acknowledging. Furthermore, during the course of the investigation, they will send out generic requests for more information without identifying the dispute or charge they are requesting more information on. Thus they are not acknowledging or fully and fairly investigate the disputed charge on my bill. I've attached a few examples I've received.

issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
consumer_complaint_narrative:
In XXXX I purchased a condo and the original creditor was XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I took out two mortgages for the condo at 80 % on first and 20 % on second. XXXX XXXX was an operating sub of XXXX and both were taken over by Bank of America in XXXX. 

In XXXX I was contacted by Bank of America via mail that I was eligible for loan modifications under the HAMP program. I contacted the using the number on the letter. The agent that I spoke to informed me that I would be eligible but first I needed to quit paying my mortgages. She stated that I needed to contact her in 3 months after non-payment. 

In three months the agent informed me that she would be sending out a modification package in the mail. Upon receiving it I filled it out and she informed me to continue to not pay my mortgages. Several months later in XXXX I received my modification package. The principal on the mortgage was {$110000.00} which was XXXX higher than the original 1st. I asked the agent about the 2nd mortgage and if I would be getting another bill. She replied that as far as she was concerned the 2nd was finished and that I was to ignore any and all bills for the property except the one sent by bank of america. She additionally stated that I would be receiving information in the future settling the 2nd mortgage and that it was going to be extinguished and discharged. She stated that I would be receiving a XXXX for the difference if there was one. 

During the modification process all financial adjustments and payments were reported on bills that were consistent with the XXXX XXXX XXXX statements. Upon completion of the trial period and upon transferring over to bank of america bills for the mortgage I received a statement from XXXX XXXX with regards to the 2nd mortgage that showed that the balance was adjusted to XXXX. It was dated in conjunction to the billing reflected on the first mortgage and the bank of america modification. 

I never received any bill with regard to the 2nd mortgage after the modification was completed. 3-4 years later I received a bill in the mail from a third party company that has been trying to collect. I emphatically deny the legitimacy of this debt. 

At the recorder of deeds it shows that the deed of trust assignment for the first mortgage was transferred to bank of america in XXXX of XXXX yet the 2nd mortgage has remained unchanged since XXXX. 

Upon conducting a title search it is clear that bank of america owns the 2nd mortgage still. I have tried to reach out via phone and email to bank of america only to get canned responses. 

I understand that in the early days of HAMP bank of america was contracting with third party companies to administrate the modifications. I also understand that these companies had poorly trained staff. I speculate that it is quit possible that while the third party organized the information and handed it back to bank of america that it is likely that the documentation was lost or incorrectly filed and that the 2nd mortgage was sold as an unsecured debt to a third party. 

I understand that in XXXX there was a settlement with the department of justice in which bank of america had to correct and amend several decisions that it had made as its practices were in violation of the HAMP program. I would greatly appreciate if Bank of America would take the necessary steps to reply to these issues responsibly so that this can come to a close. 

I have attached all documentation that is in my possession to support my claims.
company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
consumer_complaint_narrative:
During the period of XX/XX/XXXX-XX/XX/XXXX, my checking/saving/select credit Accounts in HSBC were used for the following unauthorized transactions : {$4900.00} ( XX/XX/XXXX - wire transfer from checking ) {$4000.00} ( XX/XX/XXXX - wire transfer from checking, already credited back on XXXX ) {$5000.00} ( XX/XX/XXXX - wire transfer from saving ) {$8600.00} ( XX/XX/XXXX - wire transfer from saving, already credited back on XXXX ) {$2400.00} ( XXXX - electronic transfer from checking ) {$2400.00} ( XXXX - electronic transfer from checking ) The hacker also transferred {$4500.00} from the select credit account to my checking on XX/XX/XXXX in order to facilitate some of these unauthorized transactions. 

Origin : The E-fraud prevention team from HSBC bank called me on XX/XX/XXXX and wanted me to confirm some recent online activities on my accounts. I missed their phone call initially so I tried to call back that afternoon but the wait time is too long. I finally managed to call them back next morning on XXXX. The representative informed me my accounts was compromised. He went through the unauthorized transactions with me and said only the transaction of {$4000.00} can be recalled immediately and for the rest they will investigate and get back to me in a few days. 

Couple days later I am able to see one transaction ( {$8600.00} ) credited back to my account. I called them for a status on the remaining transactions and they are still working on that. That representative said it would take a maximum of 10 days to get me a final response otherwise will credit full amount back to my accounts. 

On XXXX, I sent a formal letter to HSBC headquarter in XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX to notify them that I am a victim of identity theft and never authorize anyone else to use my accounts in any way. This is to protect me in case the bank said I never contact them in written statement about the matter. 

Afterward I called them a couple of times on XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX to get a status for the remaining transactions, and every time I was told I need to wait few more days to finish their investigation. The last time we spoke on XX/XX/XXXX, they said they need 8-10 more business days to investigate!

Note : Attached is the formal letter I sent to HSBC headquarter using certified mail. The reference number of the case they opened for investigation is : XXXX - XXXX.
company_public_response: NA

issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
consumer_complaint_narrative:
For some reason Barclays Bank Delaware has not sent me proof of my obligation of this alleged debt as requested and continues to report this trade-line to the major credit bureaus. This is creating issues for me such as higher interest rates, lower credit scores, job declines, and application rejects for outstanding balances owed. 

I disputed this account XX/XX/2019 on my XXXX  and XXXX  credit reports to no avail. To date, Barclays Bank Delaware continues to ignore my requests and they continue to ignore my consumer rights. 

I believe this account does not belong to me. I requested the documents from their files used to verify this account. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I have the right to demand they disclose all of the documents they have recorded and retained in their files at the time of the request concerning the accounts that are reporting in my credit report. All unverified accounts must be deleted. 

Who verified this account? What documents did they use to verify? Where are the documents used to verify? 

The only correspondence that I received was a letter informing me they received my dispute. This does not qualify as verification per FCRA. This company is in violation for continuing to verify the account with the credit bureaus without providing the evidence as requested. It is my contention that Barclays Bank Delaware knows they can not tie me to this alleged account, otherwise, they would have done so when I made my initial request. Barclays Bank Delaware is blatantly disregarding the law.
company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

sub_product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
consumer_complaint_narrative:
I had a credit card with Barclays. The dispute came from fees they assessed against my account. I always pay my bill in full, and they suddenly charged over {$50.00} in interest one month. I discovered later that they did this because they accidentally posted a payment on my account, and they charged me interest for three months from the time they posted the payment until they discovered the error. During these 3 months, I had been paying the full amount on my bill by the due date. 

When I discovered Barclays ' error, I made the payment in the amount that they had posted, but I contested the amount of interest because it was not my fault. I received 3 standard responses that " We are unable to complete your request. '' I stopped using my Barclays credit card, started making arrangements to get a new credit card, and I used {$75.00} in " rewards '' to reduce my balance. Then, I received a letter dated XX/XX/XXXX that stated that they had posted {$29.00} in " interest charge-purchases '' on my account on XX/XX/XXXX. The amount was the balance on my account, not the fees/interest that Barclays had charged on my account. Regardless, upon receiving that letter, I wrote a check in amount of {$29.00}, returned my credit card, and asked them to close my account, with the hope that I would no longer deal with Barclays. 

Since then, I have continued to received bills from Barclays. Apparently, they are charging a fee over {$20.00} per month on an account that has been closed and paid in full. In XX/XX/XXXX, I sent a letter to explain that they had not properly investigated my dispute, and that I should get a refund instead of bills. I received no response. Instead, I received a new statement in the amount of {$41.00}. 

I am writing to complain that Barclays ( 1 ) failed to investigate a dispute as required by the Truth in Lending Act, and ( 2 ) continued to charge fees on a closed account that has been paid in full. 

I am attaching my correspondence with Barclays regarding this matter. Thank you for any assistance you could provide.
company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Attached is a copy of my most recent mortgage statement dated XX/XX/2019 which references a reinstatement amount. ( Attached - PDF Reference 1 ) I have the ability and am prepared to make such payment in a single installment to being this loan current, although such action requires an updated quote from you. ( Attached PDF - Reference 2 ) Additionally, the mortgage statement makes reference that this amount consists of unpaid advance disbursements but does not fully itemize these amounts. ( Attached PDF - Reference 3 ) This property was subject of a foreclosure sale by Sale Committee on XX/XX/2019, although the report of the Committee has not been marked for judicial consideration ( potential approval ) until XX/XX/2019. 

Finally, there appear to be irregularities in the conduct of your legal counsel within this process with respect to Connecticut General Statue 49-31s regarding the concurrent filing of motions for default and judgment upon non-appearing parties. 

Such concurrent filings might be permitted for instances of abandoned or unoccupied residential buildings, however despite the repeated placement of " XXXX - Vacant '' stickers on an accessory ( storage/garage ) building on the property, there seems to exist no other evidence or rationale to think that this single family home actively occupied by the mortgagor ( me ) had somehow become abandoned property. 

Given the deficiencies in service and process upon me which resulted from this ( apparently ) erroneous application of the accelerated timeline, I ask for ability to reinstate this loan and request such calculation of the reinstatement payment amount in accordance with Connecticut General Statue 49-10a. 

Such payment would be made direct to your organization in single installment within 3 business days of receipt. Please provide wire transfer information ( or alternate remittance instructions ) in your response. Thank you..

consumer_complaint_narrative:
I have had a XXXX XXXX credit card from Capital One since XX/XX/XXXX. Somebody stole my card number on or about XX/XX/XXXX. I reported it stolen to Capital One on XX/XX/XXXX.

There were four pending charges on my account. One, was from XXXX  which was never actually charged. The other three were from a flower shop in XXXX XXXX, CA called XXXX. These charges were for {$110.00}, {$110.00} and {$85.00}. These were formally charged to my card onXX/XX/XXXX. For some reason that no one from Capital One could explain to me, XXXX  also refunded two identical credits of {$44.00} to my account on XX/XX/XXXX.

I spoke to three Capital One fraud agents about this. The first was on XX/XX/XXXX. They told me that the first priority was that I be made whole and that all of the money that was improperly charged on my account should be refunded to me within 72 hours.

I gave it a week. Nothing happened. I called Capital One again on or about XX/XX/XXXX. This agent said I should have had all of my money refunded to me by now and that he did not know why it did not happen.

OnXX/XX/XXXX, Capital One then simultaneously refunded me the three charges of {$110.00}, {$110.00} and {$85.00} while additionally charging me three charges of {$110.00}, {$110.00} and {$85.00}. In effect, I was still charged the money that was supposed to be returned.

The last call was XX/XX/XXXX. The fraud agents name was XXXX. Her ID # was XXXX. She told me that everyone else was wrong and that it takes an entire billing cycle to fix this problem.

consumer_complaint_narrative:

Even more confusing is that it states that I made a payment on XX/XX/XXXX. I WAS LIVING IN XXXX!!!!!!!! THE HOUSE WAS SOLD ALMOST A YEAR BEFORE THEN!!! WHICH, I HAD NO PRIOR INFORMATION ABOUT!!!!! 

I called HSBC ( contact info : HSBC BANK USA NA CREDIT INFORMATION DEPARTMENT XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IL XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX ) looking for more info on the matter and they had directed me to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. No one had given me any information proving to me that I owe the amount, yet there is still another account on my credit report showing that I do not owe HSBC anything. I will print a copy of the report and send it to your mailing address along with a copy of this complaint.

issue: Applying for a mortgage or refinancing an existing mortgage
consumer_complaint_narrative:
Dear Senator XXXX, AGO XXXX and Consumer Protection Bureau via Complaint ID # XXXX As your offices are aware, we have experienced deplorable customer service from JPMorgan Chase on our home mortgage and line of credit since XX/XX/XXXX. 

We are seniors and XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX MA XXXX, has been our primary residence since XX/XX/XXXX. We purchased our home on no doc through Washington Mutual. Chase took over the loan in XX/XX/XXXX and we refinanced from a 30 year fixed to a 15 year fixed mortgage Chase in XX/XX/XXXX. At the closing, Chase asked if we wanted a $ XXXX line of credit. We elected to accept only $ XXXX at the time, which was not accessed until XX/XX/XXXX. In  late XX/XX/XXXX, Chase invited us to increase our HELOC line from the $ XXXX to $ XXXX, but at an increase of 2 % on the entire balance. Going through the financial crisis causing negative Government effect on my FCC Broadcast ownership, XXXX and XXXX children in college, we accepted going forward with the new terms. Chase then delayed for months stating our home value decreased and despite adequate funds in the bank and questioned amount of money I was taking from my owned radio station XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, MA. In XX/XX/XXXX, Chase finally dictated to us that our only option was modification but we had to skip two payments to be considered. 

Chase then reported us to the credit bureaus and the modification approval for the stated 60 months finally came in XX/XX/XXXX, but extended only 42 months with a balloon payment for the full mortgage due XX/XX/XXXX. In XX/XX/XXXX-XX/XX/XXXX, Chase miscoded a bank routing number on a payment and then took months to determine it was their error. Then, Chase interrupted our applications for new financing by starting foreclosure notices. Chase further delayed and hindered our efforts to change lenders. 

Finally, after finally being put in touch with the Chase Executive Office in XX/XX/XXXX,  Chase agreed, in XX/XX/XXXX to a second modification at our out of pocket cost of {$36000.00}. Chase refused to spread that amount over the ensuing 200 payments in the second modification. 

In both XX/XX/XXXX and upon our XX/XX/XXXX approval of the second modification, Chase promised to A ) adjust late fees, interest charges and legal fees, B ) make sure the credit bureaus knew we were up to date on the mortgage & HELOC, C ) correct Chases superficial appraisal of our home which is at least $ XXXX too low - $ XXXX compared to a complete modification performed by XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX at $ XXXX - and D ) make arrangements to finally add to our line of credit. E ) The rate of interest on the new modification is quite high, 4.87 %. 

We continue to get lip service, run around, rude correspondence and phone conversation from Chase. The letters they have sent to me and your offices have no credibility as they do not address Chase mistakes and the horrible, inappropriate manner of customer service from Chase. The Chase letters repeat their old decisions that were incorrect in the first place. 

We are seniors, never bankrupt, with a Chase debt of less than $ XXXX on our primary/only residence HUD and the CPB valued several months ago at over {$1.00} million. Chase is disregarding the importance of our Senior Financial Health and discriminating against seniors ability to have simple access to less than 49 % of their home equity for medical, improvement, college and living expenses. Further, Chase has been rude and tremendously challenged in delaying proceedings. Chase representatives stall, take months to say its not this department and have told us to find another lender, get a reverse mortgage or move! 

With a tremendous amount of phone, email, letter, fax correspondence shared with your offices and Chase, I must ask that you now step in and hold Chase accountable for this harmful, stressful, prolonged and costly behavior negatively affecting us, and other senior customers. We ask for all fee and interest adjustments and for a favorable arrangement to have access to up to 49 % of our home FMV, without further delay. 

Please respond and thank you for protecting senior citizens who need and deserve your intervention. 

With our sincere appreciation, XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, MA. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Mortgage # XXXX Line of Credit # XXXX
company_public_response: NA

consumer_complaint_narrative:
We entered into a loan modification application process with Wells Fargo on our FHA Rehab mortgage in XX/XX/XXXXXXXX. We provided all requested documentation and were approved, and given a lower monthly payment on a 90 day trial period. No information was given as to how they arrived at this payment, or what would happen for them to achieve this payment amount, until AFTER we paid 3 months of trial payments. 

We made the first two trial period payments and Wells Fargo sent us a letter that we'd been removed from the program. I called them and found out they had sent us a letter that we had to sign and send back agreeing to the trial period. They didn't tell us it would be coming or required and it was apparently sent via regular mail, not certified or overnighted, and we never received it. That's 2 payments made. 

So they started us over again, new trial period, and we made 3 payments in XXXX, XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX. That's 5 trial period payments we made at that point. We received an email that we'd been approved for the HAMP modification and would be receiving paperwork that we would need to have notarized and sent back. No details as to what it was or any figures. Just an approval email. 

We received an overnight packet from XXXX  with the modification paperwork and figures. I called in to Wells Fargo after looking over the numbers, and I wanted a detailed itemization of the figures that they came up with to modify the loan. My foreclosure " specialist '' could not answer these simple questions - even though all the numbers are there in their computer system. She got belligerent with me on the phone about how I " better make the payment '', etc ... I sent several emails and left voicemails with ABSOLUTELY NO RESPONSE back. NO email responses from her, NO letters in the mail, NO return phone calls. 

I called and made another payment over the phone with someone else on XX/XX/XXXX ( after no explanations, no responses and no calls returned ), and then on XX/XX/XXXX, I receive a letter in the mail that they " are no longer moving forward with the HAMP program '' for our account. 

A few days later, I receive a letter from their foreclosure attorney, and last Thursday, the sheriff posted the court documents on my front door that state our foreclosure hearing is set with the county on  XX/XX/XXXX. 

We qualified for, and were approved for, a HAMP loan modification. We did not however, know what was involved prior to the trial period payments - only what the payment itself would be. 

I am not happy with the modification numbers and did not sign the documents that were sent to me, instead I wanted to work with my mortgage company to see if there was an alternative, but they REFUSE TO RESPOND and now have us set for foreclosure. I feel my rights as a consumer have been violated by the mortgage company refusing to answer questions or explain their figures, which I believe are double-dipping, and possibly fraudulent or illegal.

I have all emails I sent to the foreclosure " specialist '' and records of calls and voicemails left that were never returned. Every letter the specialist ever sent clearly stated " please call me if you have any questions ''. I had questions - she refused to answer them, and then refused to respond altogether. She removed us from the program instead. Even though we qualified for assistance. I just want to verify the numbers before signing - because they show that we will end up owing more than we started with after making three years ' worth of payments. And they were increasing our interest rate, not lowering it. They took a chunk of the principal balance and " amount in deliquency '' ( the number they refused to explain how they arrived at it ) and are setting it out as a perpetual silent second mortgage that will never be paid down or paid off until we sell or refinance the property. At which time, WF will receive all of that money - double dipping when they get it. We were not given any other option as far as lower interest rate, extended term of the mortgage, nothing.

And now, thanks to WF XXXX us around, we're even further behind in the payments. This should have been handled in a timely manner and it was NOT. It's been over 90 days since I made the 3rd payment of the trial period, and I made an additional payment last month in XXXX after not hearing anything from them. Now that they've set a court hearing, they won't accept another payment from me, and that will cause more months to go behind. 

On top of that, this company receives millions of dollars in HAMP funds each year to help people struggling with their payments - there is no evidence in these numbers that ANY HAMP funds were being used to help us. I'm not asking for free money, but if the government intends those funds to be used to help people, and WF isn't using them to do just that, then WHAT ARE THEY DOING WITH THOSE MILLIONS ( WILL BE BILLIONS BY XXXX WHEN IT ENDS ) OF DOLLARS IN HAMP FUNDS? Are they just eating that money? My trial payment letter clearly states we were in a HAMP loan modification. But every dollar is showing it's coming from us in the end, not HAMP funds at all. And now, the HAMP program is no longer accepting applications? 

I don't know where to turn at this point. But I believe this is an illegal foreclosure. We did everything they asked us to do, and we had every right to question the numbers.
company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

consumer_complaint_narrative: Bank of America is the current mortgage servicer of my second mortgage which was sold in a mortgage securities pool in XXXX. The mortgage was fraudulent upon issuing. Pursuant to 10 PA Code Section 48.3, the company issuing the mortgage used and provided fraudulent information contained in these sections of the PA code : ( 1 ) A dishonest practice or conduct is characterized by a lack of truth, honesty or trustworthiness, or is deceptive or implies a willful perversion of the truth to deceive, cheat, or defraud. ( 2 ) A fraudulent practice or conduct is characterized by deceit or trickery, an intentional perversion of the truth to induce another to part with something of value or to surrender a legal right, or an act of deceiving or misrepresenting. Fraud also includes any other  definition of fraud under applicable law. Example A : A mortgage originator employed by a mortgage broker has promised a certain low-rate mortgage loan to a consumer. However, the consumer does not have the minimum debt-to-income ratio set by the lender preferred by the mortgage originators employer to qualify for the lowest-rate mortgage loan offered. Therefore, the mortgage originator changes the XXXX statement of the consumer to reflect a higher income for the consumer without the consumers knowledge, and then submits the documentation to the lender. Example B : An employee of a mortgage lender contacts a real estate appraiser with a request to perform an appraisal and informs the appraiser that the sale price of the property is {$150000.00}. The employee knows that the property will not appraise for that amount, but promises the appraiser future business if the appraiser can make the deal work. I have had these two credit cards for many years, but between XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX,  besides my own medical and dental bills, I was taking care of my elderly mom and got my two Mastercard credit cards with Capital One maxed out. Approximately a year ago I requested that Capital One please freeze my accounts, stop all interest, and let me continue to pay on the principal balance. They would not agree to that. I also offered a {$12000.00} payoff v. the balance of approximately {$16000.00}, and they would not agree to that either. 

I was on a plan for lesser payments, but ultimately they kept requiring me to catch payments up, including late fees assessed for not making full payments, and of course interest. The amount of interest being charged monthly is more than the payments I was making. I tried to settle with them, but nothing has worked. I can not afford an attorney for bankruptcy at this time, and their payment requirements are now beyond reach. 

I was going to utilize another credit card for a no interest period, but my credit has been destroyed and my other card now has only {$1000.00} available, not the {$12000.00} I had available when this started with my trying to settle with them over the last year or more. 

I have now paid so much interest that I have more than likely paid at least half of what would have been the original balance. I would like to see if you can help in any way. I think Capital One should have let me pay on the principal balance and stopped any interest from accruing. 

According to our Constitution, interest is not legal, and maybe some day that can be enforced again, but I would ask at minimum that they reduce the balance due by removing all interest they have charged me, at least for the last year or so that I have been trying to work with them, and also late payment fees while I was making the lesser payments they agreed to.. 

They told me it would save my credit report if I made the lesser payments under their plan but obviously that has not been the case. 

I finally stopped making payments because, as I said, the interest continued to be more than any payment I would make. Since discovering MasterCard is also providing funds for the invasion of illegal immigrants into our country by providing them with prepaid debit cards, it is my feeling that they should release all debt and clear my credit report. 

Thanks, XXXX XXXX

Santander promised me that they'll give me until Friday, XX/XX/XXXX to make a payment and they will not repo the vehicle. I told them that I will make payment that day because that's when I'll receive my first paycheck from my new job. Santander agreed and gave me the extension.

I called Santander again on Monday, XXXX XXXX requesting to return the vehicle to me due to the fact they violated our agreement and the refused, instead demanding I cough up {$2700.00}.

issue: Problem with a lender or other company charging your account
sub_issue: Can't stop withdrawals from your account
consumer_complaint_narrative:
I deposited a check on XX/XX/19 in the amount of {$4900.00} and it cleared without issue. The bank can not reverse it at all. By law the checks take 2-3 days to clear. But on XX/XX/19 my account was in overdraft by that amount. My bank uncleared the check for no reason and without warning. I filed a complaint, tried to follow up with the bank, and the sender, and got no real answer. I have proof of the check clearing on XXXX in my statements, so I do not understand why this is happening to me. 

In a response from Wells Fargo they basically say nothing. Why did they clear the funds? And more importantly, once the check cleared it was my money and they can not confiscate this money without due process ( i.e., a court order ). Just saying the other bank asked for the money means nothing and it is my right to sue them for this. They are taking my money away without due course and I will be seeking legal remedy. 

Furthermore, I demand my money back. An explanation of what happened and why is not sufficient after this gross injustice. The whole point of having a bank account is knowing that my money is safe, not to wake up one day with an insufficient funds notice because one or more banks decided to unclear a check after three months. 

Additionally, on XX/XX/19 I was told by a customer service rep ( XXXX ) over the phone that the check would be returned to me because I hadn't endorsed it. I thought it was illegal to clear and unclear checks like this. They can not take away the money that belongs to me after funds are credited to my account- at that point that is my possession ). 

To conclude, Wells Fargo describing this happened does not clear the issue. They took my money away based on a no reason given issuer bank demand - that is ( at least to me ) a violation of Federal clearing laws - all check clearing related matters are governed by Regulation CC which prescribes the rules for this under the law : under Expeditious return of checks. ( which gives 2 business days to return a check ) and Notice of nonpayment ( which also asks for two days limit for such notice that notice can be via returned check, a writing ( including a copy of the check ), or telephone.

issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
consumer_complaint_narrative:
My property at XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, NJ XXXX was foreclosed upon in XX/XX/2016. XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) held a second mortgage at the time of foreclosure that remained due. The alleged amount due was {$23000.00}. XXXX Claims that they are servicing the debt for Bank of America ( B of A ) since XXXX. However, the servicing agreement between B of A and XXXX was executed on XXXX. Regardless, both B of A and XXXX claim to be collecting on the alleged debt owed. I have contacted both XXXX and B of A on numerous occasions and advised that I was never sued separately on the alleged deficiency balance due. The New Jersey law listed below was explained to both XXXX and B of A. It was ignored by both parties. The New Jersey law listed below clearly states a separate lawsuit must be filed in relation to the deficiency balance to be valid. 

Deficiency judgments are allowed in New Jersey, but not in the foreclosure action itself. To obtain a deficiency judgment, the lender must file a separate lawsuit within three months after the foreclosure sale or, if confirmation of the sale is required, from the date of the confirmation of the sale. ( N.J. Stat. Ann. 2A:50-1 through 2A:50-2.1. ) The court may limit the amount of the deficiency judgment if the borrower disputes it. The borrower may dispute the amount of the deficiency by answering the lenders suit and introducing evidence regarding the propertys fair market value. The court will then limit the deficiency judgment amount to the difference between the debt and the fair market value as of the date of the foreclosure sale. ( N.J. Stat. Ann. 2A:50-3. ) Neither XXXX nor B of A filed a separate lawsuit to bring the alleged debt to a valid status per NJ State law. This alleged should have been extinguished 3 months after the foreclosure sale date took place. However, both XXXX and B of A, have proceeded with aggressive collection activity and have reported the debt to my credit bureau report. XXXX and B or A are in violation of the FDCPA, FCRA and independent NJ State Laws. Since your agency regulates these laws, I am seeking your assistance on this matter. You can reach me at XXXX or XXXX.

consumer_complaint_narrative:
After a payout from my divorce on XX/XX/XXXX I received a phone call from the Chase Branch in XXXX XXXX to tell me I qualified for as a Chase Private Client ( although at the time my balance was tens of thousands of dollars under the qualifying amount for this status ). I went to the bank and and they organised this change in status and switched all of my accounts over accordingly ( that included my going from an entry level checking account to an account which has no fees as long as there is a minimum high balance or other qualifying events associated with my accounts which this large deposit suddenly made me eligible for ). Several months later I decided to move most of my money to retirement investments and around six months after I qualified for the Private Client status, I received another phone call to tell me I was disqualified from Chase Private Client for not having a high enough balance in my Chase accounts. I had to return to the bank and have my accounts switched back to regular accounts becasue my low income and savings meant my minimum balances would generate fees. This was all taken care of by the person who was managing my Chase Private Client status. I have since had to purchase check books and so on for this account as anyone would with a regular account. Given my salary and savings, and after transferring my funds into my retirement, if I were to walk into the bank I would not qualify for this account. 

I did not realise, until today, that the bank for some reason did not change my checking account back to a regular entry level account when they took away the private client status and changed my savings account. I have been charged $ XXXX/month for my checking account becasue they funds have been under the minimum $ XXXX. I had no idea that they skipped changing my checking account when they changed my savings and happily took me out of their program ( for which I stopped receiving any benefits from back when I lost the status - i.e no free check books etc ). I called chase and they offered to refund 2 of the payments. I believe the bank should refund all of the payments of {$25.00} they have removed from my checking account since they made the error back in late XXXX. They said I should have read the fine print on every monthly statement becasue the conditions of my account are written in there. I was led to believe I had been switched back to my regular entry level account that I had before they changed it. 

I would like to initiate a claim for these {$25.00} payments. I believe the bank made a error and are are trying to mislead me into thinking it was my fault by trying to blame me using the " read the fine print '' line. It doesn't hold up in this case.
company_public_response: NA
