sub_issue: Problem using a debit or ATM card
consumer_complaint_narrative:
Summary : A fraudster illegally withdrew {$4500.00} from my checking account at a Bank of America teller ( in person, according to Bank of America ) at a branch in XXXX   XXXX  XXXX. I live ~80 blocks away from this branch, and have a BofA branch within 5 minutes of my home. I have no reason to go to the branch in question. 

I filed a claim with Bank of America, who denied the claim on the following grounds : AUTOMATIC DENIAL because a pin and card were verified. I asked for a review of the decision and specifically asked them to check the video footage of the withdrawal. I also filed a police report with the XXXX and provided the police report number to Bank of America. After receiving this information, they denied the claim again, stating the same reason automatic denial because a pin and card were verified. 

The check fraud department confirmed to me that the video evidence had not been reviewed and the bank is refusing to review the video, stating We refuse to pull the video. Our policy requires that we ONLY PULL VIDEO FOR CLAIMS OVER {$5000.00}. There is nothing further we can do for you. 

I would like to receive back the {$4500.00} that was stolen from my account. Why does Bank of America allow fraud to go unchecked if its under {$5000.00}? 

A detailed timeline of events is below. 

XX/XX/XXXX I noticed a withdrawal of {$4500.00} on my online banking account. Neither my wife nor I had lost our debit cards or our PINs, and we had been home all day. I immediately called Bank of America to report the issue. Since the transaction was still pending they said I needed to call back after it cleared the next day. 

XX/XX/XXXX I called back and filed a formal claim. Bank of America said it would take ~3 months to review the claim, but did not provide any funds during the review. I was forced to bear the burden of the loss throughout the process. 

XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX I called the check fraud department several times to check on the status and ask if any further information was needed. Nothing further was requested and no update was provided other than to say the bank still has more time to review the claim. 

XX/XX/XXXX I was notified that the claim was denied on the following grounds : automatic denial because a pin and card were verified. I explained to the check fraud department that the card was cloned and the PIN could have been obtained via a skimmer device. 

I asked if the video footage of the withdrawal was reviewed, which would be a very simple way of conducting the investigation. The agent told me that it was not clear that the video had been reviewed, but that she would escalate the review of the decision and add a note to my account my request to review the video footage of the withdrawal. 

Agent stated it would take another ~1 month to conduct the review of the decision. 

Mid XX/XX/XXXX I called to check in on the status of the claim. I received no update. 

The agent asked if I filed a police report and I said I had not because I wasnt told it would be required. Further, the police have no bearing on whether the bank reimburses me. I was told now ( for the first time ) that the police report is a critical part of the bank 's investigation and would go a long way to resolve the claim. I said I was happy to file a police report if that would help. 

XX/XX/XXXX I had left town for the holidays, but immediately upon my return, I visited the XXXX precinct and filed a formal police report. I provided this information, including the police report number, to BofA immediately. I was told the review was ongoing. 

XX/XX/XXXX I called BofA again because I had not received any communication from them regarding the review. I was told the claim had been denied for the same reason automatic denial because a pin and card were verified. 

I asked the check fraud department agent if the video footage had been reviewed. The agent told me that the video had not been reviewed but that she would ask the analyst reviewing the claim whether they could pull and review the footage while I waited on hold. After 5 minutes, she came back on the phone to tell me the analyst has refused to pull the video. BofAs policy only requires video evidence be pulled for claims over {$5000.00}. There is nothing more we can do for you. 

I informed the XXXX, which stated that this has happened multiple times with Bank of America. In other situations, they actually obtained photographic evidence of the perpetrator and BofA still denied the claim.
company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

consumer_complaint_narrative:
Ally Bank continues to ignore repeated instructions to not enroll me in their " optional '' overdraft service. 

Ally Bank authorized a debit from my account when the balance was {$140.00}, for {$390.00}. Prior to the transaction posting I had supposedly " frozen '' my debit card from any transactions being approved through it via the " Card Control '' product. 

The Ally Bank website offers this advice : " If you didn't set up overdraft transfer service and used your debit card to make a purchase or withdraw cash, then your transaction may be declined but we won't charge an overdraft fee. '' I do not have overdraft transfer service setup, but yet, they processed this transaction and charged me an overdraft fee. 

I have tried to talk to Ally about it, however, they claim that they " may '' authorize transactions that will overdraft my account at their sole discretion and " may '' charge me that fee if that happens. 

Yet, the agreement and website state something entirely different.
company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

sub_issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
consumer_complaint_narrative:
My complaint is against Chase Bank and their credit card service. They did not provide me with a valid reason for rejection of my dispute on a transaction. 

I made a purchase with a company and they charged me the wrong amount. I contacted the company and they were unwilling to credit the difference. 

I filed a dispute with Chase and was told that if I did not have a receipt showing the amount that I was supposed to be charged, then I was liable. 

This payment was placed by phone and I never signed or agreed to any documentation to support what I was charged. The merchant responded to my dispute by sending a contract that is signed by the seller but the signature line for the buyer is blank. For some reason Chase took this contract WITHOUT a signature as proof of it being a valid charge. 

I escalated the dispute up the Chase Executive office and was again denied. I was contacted by a XXXX XXXX at XXXX XXXX. She repeated the same as the dispute department that I needed a receipt as proof of what I should have been charged. I asked her that if anyone wanted to be deceitful, they are not going to give any paperwork. 

I also asked her that if this person would have charged me {$20000.00} then agreed, that I would be liable? She stated that yes, I would be. 

I asked her if she could send me Visa rules or even Chase rules stating such. She refused and then said she would but never did. I called her two different times requesting this information and she never returned by call. 

If this is the rule for credit cards and the general public knew, that would be an end to all credit card use. Who would make a purchase by phone or internet knowing they are liable to whatever amount the merchant charges? 

Thank you for any assistance on this matter. I didnt realize until now that I had an option to file a complaint about my bank. 

I have all paperwork and letters from Chase about this dispute.
company_public_response: NA

consumer_complaint_narrative:
On Monday, XX/XX/2018, I applied for a Valley National Bank Premier Checking account which was offering a {$200.00} bonus for just opening the account with direct deposit.

I was approved and my {$100.00} initial deposit was successfully processed at the end of that week.

Few days later, after a {$100.00} ACH direct deposit from another bank posted, I got the {$200.00} advertised bonus.

Then, I withdrew all the money except {$100.00} to keep the account fee free. So, my balance of the end of XX/XX/2018 was {$100.00}.

On XX/XX/2018, Valley National Bank drained my Premier Checking account without any notification at all.

On Monday, XX/XX/2018, I noticed the Premier Checking account has no funds. The automated Valley National Bank withdrawal transaction description was REWARDS CREDITED IN ERROR. I went to the Valley National Bank XXXX  Branch that day and even though I showed screen shots with the web site offer wording, the bank officer told me a recurring qualifying monthly direct deposit of {$1000.00} or more within 90 days was required to receive the {$200.00} cash reward.

Due to the unexpected Valley National Bank reward credit reversal, the account balance was under the {$100.00} minimum required balance for several days and I would be hit with a $ XXXX  monthly maintenance fee if the account remained open by the next statement date Tuesday, XX/XX/2018.

Valley National Bank advertised offer wording was clearly misleading but the way they handled the reward credit reversal was even worse. So, I decided to close the account on Monday, XX/XX/2018.

On XX/XX/2018, I got an e-mail from Valley National Bank in which they recognized the original advertised offer was erroneous and a clear explanation of the {$200.00} bonus requirements was attached. Valley National Bank also offered me to reopen the account so I can get the {$200.00} bonus by meeting the new offer requirements.

Since I was not sure if Valley National Bank will report the cash bonus correctly to the IRS, I decided to wait until I receive their XX/XX/2018XXXX form.

On XX/XX/2019, my suspicion was confirmed when Valley National Bank sent an erroneous XX/XX/2018 XXXX form. They reported the full {$200.00} bonus to the IRS.

I just found out that Synchrony bank has been charging me {$10.00} a month on a card I've had with them since XXXX of 2015. 

For the last six months I had been wondering why I couldn't get my balance to go down. I thought maybe I had a subscription to something that I didn't realize I had subscribed to, so I cancelled the card. I was still getting these fees and not understanding where it came from. I messaged someone on the live chat. They told me I signed up for it, what it was, and why it's been there. I reacted in a very shocked manner because I really couldn't believe eyes. 

Keep in mind I'm a XXXX year old attending XXXX  full time. 

I messaged XXXX on the secure messaging system, as well as the live chat, as well as emailing synchrony and XXXX. Nobody would help me and the live chat employee told me to call a number to have them cancel and refund me. XXXX. 

I called and after being on hold for 20 minutes, the CSR answers and of course, tried to give me the run around. At this point I was furious. I kept telling her " I did NOT sign up for this, and I was NOT aware of it. I need you to cancel it and give me a refund '' I was told I'd be refunded {$360.00} ( Out of my {$610.00} total, meaning I had only accrued {$250.00} on this credit card myself. ) I never received the {$360.00} refund. 

This " optional '' security fee that nobody is informed of, ended up costing me over half of my balance. Why would I pay for something that would get rid of my debt in the event of " losing my job '', when it costs over double what my actual balance is??? THAT MAKES NO SENSE. 

This is a SCAM and it is deplorable.

consumer_complaint_narrative: In XXXX, I had a contractor come out to the house to give me a quote on fixing the roof. We had some damage to the ceiling, and wanted the roof fixed before having the interior fixed. After examining the roof, the contractor said we needed a whole new roof and recommended we file an insurance claim since the damage had caused by weather. I filed a claim with my insurance company, XXXX XXXX XXXX, and had the contractor schedule us for the new roof, since we did not want to take the chance of further damage to the interior. XXXX XXXX processed our claim quickly, dispatched an adjuster, and processed the claim. In the meantime, our contractor put on a new roof. When the claims check arrived, in addition to me, the check was also made out to XXXX XXXX XXXX and Huntington Mortgage, the lenders. I understand why they were included. XXXX XXXX XXXX was most gracious and was quickly able to arrange for endorsement of the check. Huntington, quite simple, is terrible. When I called, I was told they had MAIL me a packet of information that I had to complete, and that would take 7 days for me to receive. It actually took XXXX. What I received was a letter telling me they were n't going to pay for the roof ( WHAT? ) along with instructions to MAIL the insurance check, unendorsed, something else, and an affadavit that was supposed to be enclosed ( it was n't ). I immediate called them and, of course, got no one and had to leave a message. I 'm sure it will be next week if anyone returns my call at all. Surely, there must be, if not a law at least a rule against a bank holding my claims check hostage?

Again I asked if I could pay over the phone or mail a check and was told that was not possible and I would have to visit a bank branch. I was told the account would be closed and no further charges could be made to or from the account, and that I would receive a final bill at some point in the near future with my total amount due and an address where I could send the payment. On XX/XX/XXXX I received a notice stating that my account, including the line of credit, was official closed. The letter stated " No further advances may be made against the Cash Reserve Account ''. I asked to be transferred to a supervisor and was eventually given a PO Box address to which I was told I could send the payment. sub_product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
consumer_complaint_narrative:
I am writing because my personal credit rating dropped 180 points when I applied for a business credit card through Capital One. 

I received the attached invitation to apply for a credit card with Capital One. Per the instructions, I applied on-line and was approved for a card. We have used the card for a month and are not delinquent in our payments : our first payment is due about XX/XX/19. The card was approved XX/XX/19. Much to my surprise, I received an alert from XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/19 that my personal credit rating was downgraded on XX/XX/19 from XXXX to XXXX : entirely because of the credit card being applied to my personal credit rather than the corporation. When I called XXXX XXXX, they informed me that I simply needed to request that the credit request be reported via our tax ID number rather than my social security number as it is a business credit card. When I spoke with several people at Capital One, they informed me that we report to both business and personal credit agencies as my name is on the card and that is just the way we do it. 

This is incredibly damaging : as you can see from the flyer, there is NO indication that this card would impact my personal credit rating and I have no way of correcting it even though I have not been delinquent in paying debt, ever. This credit ding NEEDS TO BE REMOVED from my personal credit and accrue to the corporation as it is a BUSINESS and not a PERSONAL card. Even my application shows I am not the sole proprietor of this business. I would NEVER have applied for this card if I thought it would damage my personal credit so dramatically.
company_public_response: NA

sub_product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
sub_issue: Problem with rewards from credit card
consumer_complaint_narrative:
I am a XXXX XXXX XXXX member and also have their XXXX XXXX credit card. XXXX advertises a product called the " XXXX XXXX '' which, after accruing enough points during a calendar year, allows for a travel to designate a XXXX who flies with them for free - it has significant monetary value. 

In early XX/XX/XXXX, I checked my account and noticed that I needed approximately XXXX additional points in order to requalify for the XXXX XXXX  in XXXX. I checked my XXXX credit card statement payment date with Chase ( the issuer of the XXXX XXXX card ) and saw that my next payment date was XX/XX/XXXX and that I would be being enough money such that it would translate into the additional points needed to qualify for the XXXX XXXX 

In XX/XX/XXXX, I checked my XXXX account and noticed that I did not qualify for the XXXX XXXX, so I called XXXX. I was told that although the credit card payment was made on XX/XX/XXXX, that my points " always post '' on the XXXX of the month and that it was my responsibility to understand this. 

My complaint is that this is an unfair and deceptive practice. From the customer 's vantage point, points are accrued when one flies ( i.e. the flight dates ) and when one pays their credit card - it is unreasonable to expect that the layperson would know that there is a material lag between payment and posting dates which, in this case ( and probably many others ), could result in failure to obtain a marketed benefit with material monetary value.
company_public_response: NA

I have been trying unsuccessfully since that time to obtain a reversal of the charge and restoration of the money to my bank account. I spent approximately 10 hours on the telephone going through various departments at Wells Fargo Bank, and having been cut off, after being on hold, at least three or four times, and after spending many hours being passed from department to department. They continue to tell me is " being investigated, '' but will not resolve it, and they appear unwilling or unable to get to the bottom of it, or to take care of the fraud problem. They promise to call me back at specific times, but never do, and every time I call, I have to deal with it from scratch with a new person. consumer_complaint_narrative:
Synchrony Bank took over as the third party bank processing the XXXX XXXX  XXXX credit card several month ago ( around XX/XX/XXXX ). The transfer of my account from the previous company took place and there were no issues with my account balances. 

However, the new bank - Synchrony Bank has a policy in place where they reduce my auto recurring monthly payments when I make additional payments. I had calculated exactly what my payments needed to be monthly to pay off my balance without accruing interest. Then I purchased another item that needed to be paid off after my upcoming bill in order to avoid interest. Instead of changing my monthly recurring payment, I decided to pay additional amounts as one time payments and I pre-scheduled them online to be once a week. I received a letter in the mail in XX/XX/XXXX from Synchrony Bank saying they had decreased my recurring payment based on the one time payment I had made. I chatted with a representative online who told me that is how this system works. It seems unethical to me that my payment would be reduced when I choose to make additional payments. That has never happened to me, not with the previous bank nor any other bank I have had a credit card with. 

On my XX/XX/XXXX invoice I was charged interest because they reduced my payment amount without my permission. I called them on XX/XX/XXXX and they resolved my account by removing the interest charge. I received another letter in XX/XX/XXXX where they reduced my recurring monthly payment again. It has not yet posted to my account and the representative can not assist me. I have to wait to see what will happen and call again. 

I do not think it is appropriate to auto reduce someone's payment in an attempt to make them accrue interest.

consumer_complaint_narrative:
The XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, TX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/2019 Capital One Spark Business XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX, VA XXXX CEASE AND DESIST If you are represented by legal counsel, please direct this letter to your attorney immediately and have your attorney notify us of such representation.

Accordingly, you are hereby directed to CEASE AND DESIST SENDING CORRESPONDENCE TO XXXX XXXX AT XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CEO of the XXXX XXXX, is the sole owner of XXXX XXXX XXXX, located at XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, TX  XXXX It has come to our attention that you have been sending letters to XXXX XXXX, who is not and has never been, associated with The XXXX XXXX. 

We demand that you immediately ( A ) cease and desist your unlawful use of someone else 's name associate with The XXXX XXXX and ( B ) provide us with prompt written assurance within ten ( 10 ) days that you will and desist from sending correspondence addressed to XXXX XXXX. 

If you do not comply with this and desist demand within this time period, XXXX XXXX is entitled to use your failure to comply as evidence of willful infringement and seek monetary damages and equitable relief. 

In the event you fail to meet this demand, please be advised that XXXX XXXX has asked us to communicate to you that it will contemplate pursuing all available legal remedies, including seeking monetary damages, injunctive relief, and an order that you pay court costs and attorneys fees. Your liability and exposure under such legal action could be considerable. 

Before taking these steps, however, XXXX XXXX, sole proprietor of XXXX XXXX XXXX, wished to give you one opportunity to discontinue your illegal conduct by complying with this demand within ten ( 10 ) days. If you or your attorney have any questions, please contact me directly. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX, CEO cc : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IA XXXX

sub_product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
consumer_complaint_narrative:
I have an issue with my Barclay credit card where, there were some unauthorized charges to the credit card which have been place under review/dispute. Unfortunately these charges created late fees and interest charges that are not been accredited to the credit Card while the dispute is going on. I am afraid that such action by the bank will cause my credit payment history to be impacted and that I will inquire in more late and interest charges as time goes on. 
I have communicated my concern with the Bank and they have advice me to pay all interest and late fee charges as they would not be able to control whats been reported to the credit bureau and waive any additional fees. The bank also ensures that when the investigation is over that they will credit my account with all the fees but would not be able to update the credit report ( meaning the late payments will show in my credit report as valid. ). 
I believe that if there are unauthorized charges to the account and the bank starts an investigation they should not charge late fees or interest charges on the charges in dispute.

sub_issue: Didn't receive terms that were advertised
consumer_complaint_narrative:
I have a Bank of America credit card with online access. When logged into my account, there is a " Rewards & Deals '' tab at the top of the screen that then has a drop down menu that says " Special offers. '' On XX/XX/XXXX I noticed that in that special offers section I had an offer for a {$300.00} checking account bonus. I clicked on the bonus offer link and the attached PDF file is the next page I saw. Note how the expiration for this offer is XX/XX/XXXX. 


This bonus required the following : 1. That I receive it directly from Bank of America. I met this as the bonus offer was listed in the special offers tab on my individual online access. Only I have access to this offers page and the offer was listed there for me. 


2. That I open a Bank of America Advantage banking account by XX/XX/XXXX. I met this as I applied and was approved for a Bank of America Advantage Plus checking account on XX/XX/XXXX. 


XXXX. That I direct deposit {$4000.00} or more within 90 days of account opening. I set up my direct deposit with my employer to deposit my paycheck into this checking account and this requirement was met on XX/XX/XXXX. 


Those were all the requirements to receive the {$300.00} bonus. According to the offer, Bank of America had 60 days from XX/XX/XXXX to deposit the bonus into my account. The bonus should have posted to my account by XX/XX/XXXX. 


The bonus did not post to my account by XX/XX/XXXX. I called Bank of America Customer Support on XX/XX/XXXX at approximately XXXX Arizona time to inquire why the bonus did not post. I spoke with XXXX. XXXX confirmed to me that I was targeted for this bonus, but that it had an expiration date of XX/XX/XXXX. I informed XXXX that I had received the offer through the special offers tab on my online access and it stated the offer expires XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX suggested I make an appointment at a local branch and discuss this with them there, and to bring the attached PDF. She stated she would put a note on my account regarding our discussion so that when I met with them they would be aware of the situation. 


I met with XXXX XXXX at the XXXX Bank of America branch in XXXX, AZ on XX/XX/XXXX at approximately XXXX Arizona time. XXXX was unable to see the note left on my account by XXXX, and also was unable to see that I was targeted for this bonus. He could not find any record of the bonus on my account at all. He informed me he would research it and get back to me. 


I was very confused as to why XXXX was unable to see even the expired offer so I called Bank of America Customer Support again on XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX Arizona time. This time I spoke with XXXX. She was able to verify again that I was targeted for this bonus, but also informed me that it had expired XX/XX/XXXX. I informed XXXX as well that I received the offer in XX/XX/XXXX and that it showed an expiration date of XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX was unable to assist me further. 


XXXX XXXX called me on XX/XX/XXXX at approximately XXXX Arizona time to discuss what he was able to find in his research of the issue. He informed me that he now was able to see the offer that expired on XX/XX/XXXX. He had no explanation as to why an expired offer would appear on my special offers tab. He also confirmed that Bank of America would not be honoring the bonus.

issue: Problems at the end of the loan or lease
sub_issue: Problem with paying off the loan
consumer_complaint_narrative:
RE : Bank of the West loan # XXXX  For the last fifteen years or 180 plus monthly payments I have had an RV loan from Bank of the West.

I have made the 180 payments in good faith and the loan is now paid off.

But still Bank of the west has done great harm to my credit.

The situation is entirely their fault and I am seeking a remedy.

In XX/XX/2018 my RV loan with Bank of the West matured. I was sent a notice stating such.

The notice simply stated that the loan had matured and offered no other details. I was a bit confused because I still had payment coupons left in my payment book. I called the XXXX number for customer assistance to clarify the situation and get a payoff amount. I was told by the agent that the payoff amount was just over 4000 dollars. I was also advised by the Bank of the West agent that I could simply continue making the standard monthly payment and that would bring down the principal balance to a point where it was palatable to payoff. No mention of credit bureau reporting was made. So I continued to make the standard monthly payment.

I also continued to receive notices that payment had been received.

I thought everything was fine and planned to payoff the loan once the payoff amount was down to XXXX dollars.

In XX/XX/XXXX I received a notice from Bank of the West that the bank was about to report a charge off ( default ) to the credit bureaus. I immediately called to get the payoff amount and make the final payment.

The loan is now paid in full but Bank of the West has nearly destroyed my credit. They have reported my loan to the bureaus as 60 and 90 days late, this was NEVER indicated to me in either verbal or written communications.

At this point Bank of the West has all of their money and interest, I have the RV, but my credit is ruined.

Nor have I been given an explanation of why after 180 payments there was still a XXXX dollar balance.

I think the best way of resolving this issue is for Bank of the West to remove the derogatory credit items from the credit bureaus and restore my credit score. I would also like a detailed accounting of why the payoff amount was so high.

issue: Problems at the end of the loan or lease
sub_issue: Problem with paying off the loan
consumer_complaint_narrative:
Back in XXXX of XXXX, I was in a car accident that was not any fault of my own, but it totaled my XXXX XXXX XXXX. I was financed with huntingon bank, I immediately called insurance got a claim started that night - insurance and gap got started paying it off and started communications with Huntington bank to get the card fully paid off, in the mean time, I had to finalize my divorce and was changing jobs - but was able to go get a new lease for a lower payment on another XXXX. Insurance and gap and I were all communicating, along with Huntington to ensure it was all paid off. From what I understood gap was covering the rest of the finances amount, so it was all to be paid off. Well I got a call from Huntington about a balance, I called insurance and gap and they said they would communicate with them to get it paid and for me not to worry about it. 

Well then I get a 30 day report showing from them on my credit for {$450.00} - meanwhile Im a newly divorced single mother trying to sell my house and get a new home that is within the mile distance allowed from my ex husband. That tanked my credit and put me under qualifying. I called them to see what happened and they said gap had sent in the payment late but it didnt cover {$450.00}, and then they told me as of the day i called, XX/XX/XXXX i believe, that I was 60 days late. 

Now I know {$450.00} doesnt sound like a lot But when you are newly divorced, now make $ XXXX and not your salary you were used to AND youre having to move, and a mom paying expenses for kids - {$450.00} is a lot. 
I asked to do a payment plan, or have a rewrite - they denied me and started having condescending tones asking me what changed and why couldnt I pay all the sudden, and that gap had not covered it for the total loss car for this amount and it was left to me. They told me I could make small payments, but they would consistently report me late. 
I let them know I wasnt even aware this was a balance left, & gap & insurance told me stop communicating with them because they were handling it. 
I ended up having to pull favors from friends to rally the money to pay them and begged them not to report me 60 days late. 


******I asked since I wasnt aware could it be removed from my credit for the delinquency - they were making or breaking me being able to move where I am supposed to near my ex husband- they wouldnt budge, wouldnt even discuss the idea. But how can I be penalized for something I thought was handled and then still gathered the funds to handle it anyways? 
I do not understand - ****all I want is the delinquency removed from my credit - Ive paid them, I just want the delinquency removed. I need my credit to be clear of that to be able to get my obligations on track, I have an amazing credit history - my only issue is high credit card balances because Im a broke single mom.

sub_issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
consumer_complaint_narrative:
I have asked Synchrony Bank to provide in writing their reasons for accepting or declining the Tender of Payment i XXXX XXXX XXXX had only received a phone call and they left me a voice message stating that the payment was sent to the back office and that they would be looking into the tender and processing that tender, i have not received any notices of any other kind. 

XXXX : PROCESS REQUEST NUMBER - Contract # XXXX XXXX XXXX contract # XXXX AFFIDAVIT OF TRUTH THIS AFFIDAVIT IS SELF AUTHENTICATING BY WAY OF THE LAWFUL NOTIFICATION : FOR TENDER OF PAYMENT OFFERING RECEIVED ACCEPTED OR DECLINED IN WRITING I HAVE NOT RECEIVED. 
Come now and notice that I the woman owner of said property acquired by purchases! havent received a letter [ s ] from the CEO or Controllers from the Back Office of Synchrony Bank, agency or corporation concerning the decline of the Tender of Payment Offer. Please provide in writing your legal and or lawful reason [ s ] for not accepting the government obligations, bills of exchange, drafts, notes, trade acceptances, and bankers acceptances, because it is backed by the credit of the nation. A letter from the Research Department is not the proper channel for this type of payment because they do not know what the Tender Of Payment is! Such is legal Tender for property and this card was used to secure such.

A copy of the Tendered payment was mailed to the US Treasury and received for you to retrieve payment! Please note ; In the United States, a mortgage note ( also known as a real estate lien note, borrower 's note ) is a promissory note secured by a specified mortgage loan. Mortgage notes are a written promise to repay a specified sum of money plus interest at a specified rate and length of time to fulfill the promise. It's the promissory note that contains the promise to repay the amount borrowed. ( Learn more about promissory notes. ) While a promissory note is basically an IOU that contains the promise to repay the loan, the contractual agreement is the document that pledges the property as security for the loan.

3-603. TENDER OF PAYMENT. ( a ) If tender of payment of an obligation to pay an instrument is made to a person entitled to enforce the instrument, the effect of tender is governed by principles of law applicable to tender of payment under a simple contract. ( b ) If tender of payment of an obligation to pay an instrument is made to a person entitled to enforce the instrument and the tender is refused, there is discharge, to the extent of the amount of the tender, of the obligation of an endorser or accommodation party having a right of recourse with respect to the obligation to which the tender relates. ( c ) If tender of payment of an amount due on an instrument is made to a person entitled to enforce the instrument, the obligation of the obligor to pay interest after the due date on the amount tendered is discharged.

consumer_complaint_narrative:
A few months ago I received a Chase Sapphire Reserve card from Chase. The initial offer said that I would receive XXXX points after spending a certain amount within the first 3 months of having the card. It also states that for Sapphire Reserve members, each point that is used towards travel booked through the Chase site is worth 1.5 times  the actual points in my rewards account. 

Approximately three weeks ago I attempted to use my points to book a flight for XX/XX/2019. When I got to the purchase page on the site, it didn't allow my card to go through. I called Chase Travel directly to try and book the flight, they also couldn't purchase it and claimed there was a problem with their computer system. They didn't offer a timeline for it being fixed, and I submitted a claim, claim number XXXX. They said I would receive a follow up contact regarding my claim, which I never did, and when I called back days later they had no claim in their system matching that number or related to my card For the past three weeks I have continuously tried to use the site to use my rewards only for an error to pop up each time. I tried again to book a flight through Chase today, only to receive an error message saying the Chase travel site was unable to load. I called Chase travel and they told me there was a red flag on my account stating that my card was not a card eligible for travel rewards. They transferred me to the rewards department, who told me that there was no such red flag on my account, then transferred me back to travel who stated that there was nothing that they could do and no other department they could contact to resolve the claim. 

The flight I'm trying to book is a family trip, but I have to purchase my wife and son 's tickets separately. Since the time I've started trying to use MY rewards, that trip has gone up in price approximately {$1200.00}. No one from Chase has returned any of the calls from my claims or offered an alternative solution, and I have over XXXX points through their system that I am unable to use with no one willing to help resolve the claim

issue: Problem with a lender or other company charging your account
consumer_complaint_narrative:
6 Merchants withdrew from our bank account during the 2018 year without authorization a total of {$16000.00} via repeated ACH withdraws. These merchants are XXXX, XXXX  XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX and XXXX. I noticed these withdrawals in XX/XX/XXXX and reported them to the Bank. The Bank filed 6 claims but later decided that these claims are subject to the 60 days grace period rule. Which means all these losses are my responsibility because I did not notice or report these unauthorized withdrawals in the first 60 days. The Bank refused to provide any assistance to recover these funds from the six merchants and refused to supply any information about the merchants legal information. Although many of the withdrawals meet the 60 days rule, namely, reported within the 60 days of the frauds occurrences, the Bank did not follow Consumer Protection Regulations regarding ACH, outlined in 1005.6 Liability of consumer for unauthorized transfers. The Bank did not even attempt to recover the withdrawals from the merchants. The Bank advised me to contact the merchants. After contacting the merchants, the merchants requested that it is the Bank that should report and recover the funds. 
It is also important to note that two of the withdrawals happened a few days after I reported the frauds in XXXX and after the Bank Branch manager confirmed with me they will fully control my account and promised that XXXX  withdrawal be refunded. 
Before the above six frauds happened, a seventh merchant, XXXX, and as early as XXXX XXXX withdrew via ACH four payments and after reporting the claim, I recovered these funds, however, the Bank did not warn me or advise me that XXXX withdrawals were fraudulent. If the Bank warned me about ACH fraud or advised me to take measures in early XXXX, all these frauds could have been avoided. 
All along, I assumed that the Bank uses a formal process to authorize ACH withdrawals and request a written authorization or any sort of form to prove that ACH transactions are approved by their clients. Many other merchants who legitimately withdrew monies from our Bank account have followed a formal process to withdraw monies.

RE : Late payment on XXXX 2016 Late Payment .... 

Dear Manager ; I am notifying you of issues with the information on my credit report. I am curious as to how you are allowed to report this information. With a little research, I found out that I have some rights in place. This letter will serve as a formal dispute under FACTA section 312. This law gives me the right to dispute my credit information directly with you instead of dealing with the run-around that happens when someone goes to the credit bureau. Please take note that I have already dealt with the so called investigation process that the bureaus claim to have completed. Nonetheless, I now wish to exercise my rights to dispute this account directly with you.

I would like to dispute the inaccurate reporting of the above account. Please verify the following : That all balances and amounts are reporting correctly.

That all dates are reporting correctly and that any prior pay history you are reporting is correct Please remove this account from my credit report immediately! It has caused quite bit of damage. I want to point out that you are legally liable for any erroneous information as decided in XXXX vs. XXXX XXXX. This case set a legal precedent that a consumer can sue you for reporting inaccurate information on their credit report. I demand that you remove this account immediately. Should this account not be taken care of, my next step will be to file complaints with the FTC, XXXX, State Attorney General, and any other place I can think to file a complaint. I trust this matter will be handled promptly. 

Thanks for your prompt attention to my concerns, Sincerely yours, XXXX

I reported the card theft to Chase that day, and the charges were adjusted off on my XXXX statement, showing a zero balance ( showing {$1400.00} cash advances before the adjustments ). I explained that I had not made the charges, which led to a brusque accusation that since my PIN was used and she could not figure out how that could have been done by anyone else, I " had received benefit from this transaction. '' The only way to avoid it was to prove that I had not used the card. Since my 78 years of integrity and several years as a Chase card member was not sufficient proof, she said there was nothing she could do. I still do not know how anyone can prove a non-action. So, my XXXX statement showed all the charges, plus more service fees. I made the minimum payment, which was then reflected on the XXXX statement along with more service fees ; I made another payment on the XXXX statement. In the meantime, I also disputed the charges by letter with the executive in charge, which led to a curt reply from a person who claimed to be a representative of the executive unit and the final authority on any appeal, who stated that the prior action of the fraud unit was confirmed and that I had no other recourse. ( Through all this, I still have not seen the detail of the charges that were added after the XXXX statement, so I do not know when they were made. ) I am shocked at the total disregard of my statement that I did not make the charges as well as the subsequent arrogance and stonewalling of the fraud unit and the executive unit. How can Chase be allowed to prey on people who have no way to defend themselves! I initially thought I was being singled out but now realize after seeing many similar complaints on the CFPB data base that this is a common practice engaged in by Chase.
company_public_response: NA

sub_issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
consumer_complaint_narrative:
In XX/XX/XXXX I was offered a position with XXXX XXXX  in XXXX, which I accepted and began working with this company in XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX XXXX  required me to be in XXXX in XX/XX/XXXX and one two weeks out of every month for the remainder of the year. 

I maintained my residence in XXXX and never moved to Michigan. I stayed at a hotel for the entire month of XXXX and then, in order to be more cost effective, I rented a house in XXXX XXXX, which XXXX reimbursed me for. This property was for myself and one other employee who was based out of XXXX. During this same time period, I brought my personal vehicle to XXXX so that I did not have the added expense of renting a vehicle. While XXXX did reimburse me for rental costs, it was more cost effective for me to drive my own vehicle. Not to mention, the insurance was immensely cheaper, and as a XXXX, I was more comfortable in my own truck. 

While it appears that this lawsuit began some time ago, I was just recently notified of same, when my PREVIOUS employer, XXXX XXXX XXXX, sent me a copy of a garnishment notice. I am still unsure as to who the company representing the original creditor is, as in my research I have located confusing and conflicting information showing both XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX and at this point am unsure as to who is representing who. 

I have attempted to verify the debt is valid with XXXX XXXX   XXXX ; however, they have been unable to provide me with an original signed contract or billing statements representing the entire time they have indicated this card was in use. 

XXXX XXXX  XXXX did provide me a copy of the judgment they filed, as well as their proof of service. The process servers notes on the Motion and Verification for Alternate Service confirm that it was a male staying at the property when they spoke to the neighbor, " Neighbor XXXX female at XXXX confirmed address - said HE drives a truck ''. While the process server may in fact have heard a TV on in the property, it was not me staying there at that time. The process server goes on to note that " defendant has had plenty of time is evading service. '' If evading service means that I was in XXXX, at MY HOME, then I guess that could be construed as an accurate statement. 

The process server then posted the debt lawsuit documents on the door. These documents were NOT in an envelope or concealed in any manner from third party viewing. They were affixed to the front outside door with tape, and were discovered and taken by the landlord, who proceeded to send pictures of each page of the document to the party that was at the property that week, in addition to my work. 

My lease at the property was terminated shortly after this incident occurred. It seemed coincidental at the time, it doesnt any longer. It appears as if my lease was terminated due to the information posted at the property. 

At that point, I was in XXXX working remotely, and was only in XXXX for one week out of every one or two months. For this reason, I did not establish another rental in XXXX. 

The lawsuit, judgment, and any other entries of default that have been filed into a court system in XXXX, should never have occurred as I was never a resident of XXXX  in XXXX, XXXX, XXXX. Hence the XXXX  XXXX county license plates and a mailing address in XXXX, XXXX. My state income taxes were also filed as a resident of XXXX, not XXXX. 

On another note, as youll notice, the last 4 pages of the documents they provided to me for verification, are for an entirely different person. I would wager to guess that this person, and every other person they are filing suit against, would be less than pleased to note the obvious carelessness and lack of oversight in their business practices. Are they able to state with any certainty that MY information hasn't been inadvertently sent to another??
company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

consumer_complaint_narrative: I purchased a house and the closing date was XX/XX/XXXX. The mortgage had a {$620.00} loan origination charge to buy a quarter percent lower interest rate. Mr XXXX has given me numerous dates over the past year of when the credit would be applied but all of those dates have come and gone with no credit. I have asked to talk to XXXX XXXX and have left messages for him to call me back but have never received a call back. I believe that XXXX XXXX originally tried to resolve all of the closing issues by committing to the {$620.00} credit without supervisor approval and his supervisors will not sign off on it. Upon further investigation, I discovered that Synchrony and/or XXXX had, without my permission, registered me for " debt cancellation '' insurance at a cost of 1.6 % of the monthly balance on the account. I did not request or accept the service when I purchased the furniture. The charges simply appeared on my monthly statement. The terms and conditions, which I subsequently discovered, state that all charges will be refunded if the service is cancelled within 90 days. Luckily I noticed the charges and cancelled the service with two weeks to spare, although it remains to be seen if the fees will be refunded.

consumer_complaint_narrative:
Tuesday XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX I was excited to open a business account for the 1st time. I thought I had all my documents, but I was missing my EIN number. XXXX told me I could get the IRS to fax the information to bank. But in the meantime, he could set-up my personal account. While he was doing that, I was looking up the IRS number on my phone. When I got on the IRS web page it would not let me click the number to dial. So, I got XXXX 's sticky note cards on his desk write the number down. 

I call the IRS but shortly hung-up because the lady that was assisting XXXX told me that she another number which was essential the same number I JUST dialed previous. 

I was a bit aggravated because I was already waiting on hold for 7 minutes and I had another appointment to attend XXXX XXXX. I gather my things and left. 

Few hours later I got a call from XXXX asking, I did I accidentally grip a business card when I was gathering my things? 

So, I search my car, purse, wallet but I didn't see it. I give him a call back to confirm told him I'll be back on Friday to finish the business account. 

Friday, XX/XX/XXXX XXXX 2nd try to open the business account. When I arrived, I told the lady at the front desk I wanted to open a business account and I have the IRS on the line to fax my EIN. The lady that was helping me didn't even know the bank had a fax machine. The was the 1st flag! The IRS confirm the fax was sent the 2 lady claimed they didn't receive it. So they provide me with another fax number the IRS confirmed again it was send. The lady received it but didn't see my personal profile set-up yet and XXXX had to finish it to gain credit for the account. 2nd red flag! I was under the impression XXXX set-up my personal account on Tuesday as he stated ... ... 

I go to XXXX 's desk. He asked me look through my purse again for the business card. I did and I found it in my wallet mixed in with the other business cards, I apologized and gave it back to him. In my mind it was a total accident. No big deal. Suddenly, the lady from Tuesday that give me the same number for the IRS comes over and accuses me of stealing a business card and needed an explanation. I told it was a total mistaken it was NOT intentional. XXXX and this lady when back and forth with me over a BUSINESS CARD of a PERSON I DO NOT KNOW or CARE to KNOW!!!! They were asking why would I do that? Why would I take bank property information? We saw the cameras and saw you put it in your purse. AS IF I WAS A CRIMINAL!!! They made me feel like I was a THIEF and discriminated against! 

I'm TELLING THESE FOLKS IT WAS A PURE ACCIDENT!!!! WHY WOULD WANT BUSINESS CARD FROM SOMEONE I DO NOT KNOW!!! They are in cahoots together saying we are trying to know why too. During this process, I felt harassed and discriminated against. After all of that they asked me are you sure you still want to open your account with us. Red flag number 3!!! Deep inside I didn't because I thought those actions were not called for but .... 

Since I just drove from XXXX XXXX, GA to XXXX, GA during my lunch break, was on hold with the IRS for 35 minutes to get my EIN faxed and I had ALL my paperwork I just needed my account now so I could go! 

They XXXX started acting like my EIN number was not valid even though the IRS JUST FAXED .... 

After an hour and a half later, he provides me with a rejection letter stating they can not open my account with no indication of why!!!!! 

NOW, I FEEL LIKE THIS IS DEEPER MATTER AND I FEEL BEING WRONGFULLY TARGETED!!! 

Please see the attachment below : ( As you can see there is no REAL reason checked why I could not open an account ) FYI- I opened my account with XXXX XXXX  today with no issue under 30 minutes with the exact same documentation.

issue: Advertising and marketing, including promotional offers
sub_issue: Didn't receive advertised or promotional terms
consumer_complaint_narrative:
1. On XX/XX/18, a Home Depot Salesperson, XXXX XXXX, signed us up for two home improvement projects ( new rain gutters and a new sliding-glass door/window ). He never provided us receipts for these services nor has Home Depot or their installers, so we have no way of comparing prices to what we see on our Home Depot credit card statement.

2. Also onXX/XX/18 Mr. XXXX called up Home Depot 's Consumer Credit telephone line and signed us up for a Home Depot credit card promising us a 2-year interest-free promotion. He initialed our Consumer Credit Application " XXXX XX/XX/18 '' and the telephone representative confirmed the 2-year interest-free promotion on these home improvement projects, repeating various times that our call was being recorded for " quality assurance. '' 3. It took many weary, frustrating months to get Home Depot to schedule the installations of these projects, but they were finally complete just before XXXX  in mid-XX/XX/XXXX ( over 3 months after Mr. XXXX 's sales visit ). Again, we never received receipts or invoices for these repair projects, so we simply have to " trust '' that our bill is correct. However, the initial bills did NOT honor the promotional 2-years interest-free rate promised us by the salesperson Mr. XXXX, by the telephone consumer credit representative at the time we signed the agreements and application, and even by the Home Depot scheduler over the months it took to get the projects installed.

4. I wrote several complaints about the billing statements not honoring the 2-year interest-free promotional rate without resolution. It appeared a robot was responding to my complaints. I finally had to call the so-called " Consumer Care '' line during " business hours '' ( difficult for a full-time working mom/XXXX  ) to resolve the issue, as my bill said it would start accruing interest as ofXX/XX/XXXX ( i.e., 6 months interest-free, not the 24 months that I was quoted at the time of sale and application as well as repeated in calls with the Home Depot scheduler ).

5. Today,XX/XX/XXXX, I sat down to pay my bill that is due in XX/XX/XXXX, and I see that I have acquired a surprise interest charge of {$2.00}. No, it's not a lot, but it is a sneaky fee that makes me again doubt the business practices of this company that has offered my 24-months interest free. I further noticed that this is the first billing statement that warns me of a " revolving balance '' that can accrue interest. However, this information is buried on page 3 near the end of the statement, i.e., buried beneath all of this information : Summary, Payment Information, Promotional Balances, Advertisements for gift cards, Billing Coupon, Information About Your Account, Key Credit Terms, Change of Address Form, Another Advertisement for Nest, etc.

6. I have never seen a more confusing billing statement, and I have several credit cards and am vigilant about my credit, my debt, and my bills. For example, I have an XXXX XXXX Citi Master Card, a XXXX XXXX American Express Card, and a XXXX XXXX XXXX Visa Card. None of these billing statements from other companies have deceived me. I am confident in accusing Home Depot 's consumer credit card with deceptive business practices. In addition to not honoring quoted promotions, the billing statement buries fees and is difficult to read. It frequently has mistakes and it does not explain what the date or nature of each purchase. Instead of clearly marking a date and citing the transaction with something like HVAC service or window installation, window materials, or window down payment, etc. ; the bill simply lists as follows : " Revolving Balance NO INT FOR 24MOS-PMT REQ NO INT FOR 24MOS-PMT REQ NO INT FOR 24MOS-PMT REQ NO INT FOR 24MOS-PMT REQ. '' 7. To make matters worse, Home Depot and their service providers have provided no receipts for these services, so I have no way of comparing my billing statement to my receipts or invoices. In other words, I am at the mercy of Home Depot 's supposed honor system here, when I have already discovered various mistakes and problems with my bill.

8. It blows my mind that this company has such deceptive and incompetent business practices, and I would NEVER recommend this card to anyone else. I am tempted to just pay it off in full before the 24-month promotion ends in order to not accrue any more headaches with this company, but I do have other home improvement projects that I need to spend my available funds on.
company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

The XXXX package was delivered to my home address however, I did not purchase the package, nor did I authorize the purchase. I did not return the package to XXXX because I was assured by Citi that I would be credited for the unauthorized purchase, and I did not want to commit fraud by being reimbursed from both Citi and XXXX. Because I was assured by Citi that the dispute would be resolved in my favor, I donated the package to a local food bank. I have not ordered anything from XXXX before or since this dispute and I have not disputed a charge before XX/XX/19. I sent a letter to Citi on XX/XX/19 explaining the situation and the various reasons why a credit card thief might send a package to the victim 's home, but I have not received a response. I simply want {$400.00} credited to my Citi Card account because I did not purchase the XXXX products and I was assured by Citi that I would not be penalized for the unauthorized charge.

consumer_complaint_narrative:
A loan request ( refinance ) was done XX/XX/2019. It was denied. 
Verbally, a representative took the complaint regarding the extra interest. Chase refused to refinance and never addressed that. Chase sent papers for " voluntarily surrendering '' the vehicle. Using Chases secure messaging a request was made asking that Chase " waive the defiency ''. This was also denied. When the vehicle was purchased I was told I could refinance in 6 months. That was not true.There were several misconceptions. 

During this time Chase phoned no less than 8 times, which would have been great had I known it was Chase. The calls were all toll free and I thought they were robotic calls trying to get money. Also, I did not know how to retrieve the voice mail. My wife got them all today Monday XX/XX/2019. When I became ill my wife stopped working to care for my needs. So the extra income we had was gone. A lower interest rate would have really helped during this difficult time. It is emotionally and financially draining. 

Late fees were applied more than I can remember. No matter if the payment was on the XXXX or XXXX day of the month, there was a late charge. That was never addressed. Verbally, Chase said " payment isn't late till the end of the month ''. That wasn't true. This was also a hail damaged vehicle. Because of my XXXX I couldn't see all the damage on the top of the care. 
Below is what I believe has happened with me ; Article by XXXX XXXX " The editorial page of the XXXX XXXX XXXX recently weighed in on an important but underappreciated aspect of the financial crisis : The systematic targeting of communities of XXXX for risky and unfair loans. As the XXXX put it : Pricing discrimination illegally charging minority customers more for loans and other services than similarly qualified XXXX are charged is a longstanding problem? '' After the fact of dealing with Chase, several articles have stated that higher interest rate loans are given because they know you will default because rates are too high to be paid back. Shame on Chase. 
Being an older person I thought I would be treated fairly and without partiality. That isn't true. 
We are doing the best we can under our circumstances. 
Thank you, XXXX XXXX

sub_issue: Credit card company won't work with you while you're going through financial hardship
consumer_complaint_narrative: I am on a set income. I have been though a situation which resulted in me being forced to initiate a 3 1/2yr civil matter that ended in XXXX and affected me financially. am still paying the cost of my representation and will continue doing so for the next 2yrs. I have never had such awful money problems. I had been successfully paying my cards off, buying essentials with them and my family would help if any medical problems or the like occured. My father 's workplace shut down and he lost his job early last year. At that point I had no help. In XX/XX/XXXX I missed my first payment to Kohl 's since I opened the account in XXXX. I continued paying everything I could but I could not pay in full after they shot my payment up to over {$120.00}. I contacted them but paid the amount initially thinking it would help, it didn't. Each payment thereafter accrued a higher fee like the inital missed payment. As I said, I contacted Kohl 's via their website message center on the payment page about my missed payment. I explained how long I had been a customer, that I'd been a VIP cardholder for the majority of that time, paid more than asked every chance I got and asked if they could drop the late fee, split it up or lower their " base '' interest rate. Explained I was struggling and so were my bills but wanted to get back on track. I let them know I was and would keep doing everything I could to keep my bill in good standing. They were far from empathetic. It continued to be like this every time I contacted them, at times the rep acted as if my distress and confusion was humorous. I grew increasingly frustrated, broke and behind on my other bills. I paid as much as I could when I could. Around XXXX I told the rep I was going to be forced to file bankruptcy if I didn't close my longterm account with them which had always been in good standing abd that I did not want to do either but could not keep paying these {$100.00} late fees and my monthly fee, to which they responded they'd just closed the account for me. From then on out I saw no balance changes but increase and was only given the option to pay the full $ XXXX+ owed ( back then ) every time I paid, they were still adding fees to each payment. I continued to maintain contact and attempted to find out why I was being increasingly charged extra each month. I did not find out until I checked my credit report last night after getting an alert from an XXXXand noticing another card had revoked 1/2 of my spendable amount. Around 3mo into this I started getting emails, phone calls and letters claiming to be someone collecting a debt on Kohl 's behalf and asking for full payment of the fee or a payment match option. I researched the option, it was a scam according to people who had tried it. I did not recieve another bill from Kohl 's, I didn't know who I owed but I paid. I just discovered Kohl 's had reported my account as delequint to all 3 credit agencies and is collecting my activity by way of an investigation watch. They have also been making inquiries and claims of ownership under seperate entitiy names for months and a bank I'd never dealt with. It's affected all of my accounts. The information shown regarding XX/XX/XXXX-XX/XX/XXXX payments, amounts, dates and balance they gave XXXX  does not match the information they gave XXXX. I was not able to get my score fron XXXX, I will have to contact them. The initial late payment date was reported, XX/XX/XXXX, but they did not show that as the initial flag. Starting in XXXX they have multiple 30day late months listed in a row, then 90 and then 120. They do not have the same balance/dates on both CRA 's and I do not have the information they gave them. I apparetly DID have a minimum payment option all along which is how they kept hitting me with a fee even after closure because I was still paying as I should have been. They actually claim I had the option of a minimum payment! 13 years I'd spent growing that account. One late fee and apathetic supoort rep later it's gone. The CRA 's accounts show every prior payment was paid. I was told I could reopen the account when I paid the fee off by the rep. I feel like it was just a game to them. On my report the minimum payment of {$120.00} a month shows up after XXXX or thereabouts. I was never told the truth and it makes me extremely angry. This very month it stated {$550.00} as my only payment option. Even though I'm just around {$270.00} over my balance. I would have borrowed money from my now newly hired Father and paid the fee off in 2-3mo if I had been given the chance. Each payment I made attempting to pay the fee carried whatever I did not pay of that hidden {$120.00} over as another late fee. I was intentionally kept in a late, unpaid state. There's no way to deny it. The " 120 '' day very late adverse account is now on my credit reports along with an insulting lie stating the creditor chose to close the account. Due to this my credit score is dead, other company 's have begun cutting my credit lines and everything 's now being flagged. It's taking my credit score down 5pts a day. I do not believe the incorrect information on file is fair, it's not a true representation of what occurred, nor do I believe the adverse account should have been flagged, I'm paying. I feel as if this was a petty jab made just to bring attention to it and further ruin my credit. I was not given any information apart from being made to think the debt had been sold last year. It makes me look like I have intentionally been dodging the minimum {$120.00}. I would like to see this removed from my credit report. I should not have my ability to get help or current cards stripped when I have genuinely tried to do my part.
company_public_response: NA

Hello, I have the Chase Sapphire Reserve Credit Card, mostly because of its travel benefits. I am traveling to XXXX with the card and in order to obtain my visa, I just need a simply letter that says " for the duration of the trip, this person is covered by the Travel Insurance provided by the card ''. 

In XX/XX/XXXX, I called Chase asking for this letter and they forwarded me to their Rewards department. The Rewards department was extremely rude and hostile and told me they could provide me no such thing. 

On XX/XX/2019 I submitted a note through the Chase contact options. I explained what had happened, the fact that I had to pay {$82.00} for a different health insurance policy in XXXX because they would not provide me the letter, in addition to the {$450.00} a year I pay on this card to have benefits like travel insurance. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, after back and forth, I received this email : We apologize for any inconvenience you may have experienced and we understand your concern. 

I'm an account supervisor with the Secure Message Center and will be happy to assist you with your Chase Sapphire Reserve. 

Please be assured we've documented your complaint about your attempts to secure a travel letter and the additional policy. I have forwarded it to the appropriate area of Chase for further review. 

Regrettably, we are not able to reimburse for the additional policy. We base this on the terms and conditions of the Ultimate Rewards program  agreement. 

Please be assured that I have forwarded your concerns to our Feedback Team. This team is in place to review our processes to improve the customer service experience. 
While no immediate changes may be made, we always welcome and appreciate feedback from our customers as it allows us the opportunity to improve. 

A multi-billion dollar company can not reimburse me {$82.00} for a flaw in their policy and guidelines. They then closed the chat so I could not follow-up or ask to work with anyone else, silencing the issue.

consumer_complaint_narrative:
I am writing to inform you of an absurd bank policy that I had the unfortunate situation of being caught in the middle of. On XX/XX/2019, I was wired {$28000.00} USD from a family member assisting my family and I with medical expenses. Unfortunately, when sending the wire, my uncle left off the last digit of my account number -- all other information was correct such as spelling of my full name. My bank, Capital One Bank, deposited the money in the incorrect account ( identical to my account minus the last digit ). They have explained that they are under no obligation to check information on the wire and that they are not able to assist me in freezing/retrieving the money from this incorrect account.

Capital One has closed its " investigation '' into the matter and is no longer willing to speak with me on the subject. They have indicated that they have not received a recall attempt from the sending bank, which I have multiple confirmation documents that recall attempts were sent via XXXX messaging ( basically the same way the original wire was sent -- successfully ). I have attempted to escalate this matter multiple times throughout XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX with no success. I've asked for help from Capital One Bank in explaining the proper procedure the sending bank should follow to ensure that the recall message is received, but they explained they did not know. 

I am speechless that a bank would allow this to happen and have no recourse to rectify this mistake. I look forward to hearing your thoughts on the matter.
company_public_response: NA

consumer_complaint_narrative:
In late XX/XX/XXXX and early XX/XX/2018, 4 fraudulent withdrawals were made from my bank account ( s ) with Bank of America. These transactions were : {$900.00} Cash Withdrawal in  XXXX XXXX, CA on XX/XX/2018. A Fraudulent check for {$2300.00}, returned on XX/XX/2018. A fraudulent check for {$2200.00}, returned on XX/XX/2018. A fraudulent check for {$2100.00}, returned on XX/XX/05. 

Upon first noticing the fraud on XX/XX/2018, I contacted Bank of America, and they closed my then-current account to open a new one. In subsequent days, the additional fraudulent transactions listed above came in - including one in the NEWLY OPENED bank account, for which I hadnt yet received a Debit Card or PIN ( because the representative forgot to send it to me, which was indicative of my entire experience with Bank of America throughout this long process ). This means that, despite my account being locked and a fraud alert being placed upon it, a teller at some branch allowed additional fraudulent activity to take place.

The fraud department has told me that an investigation will take 60 business days to complete. In the meantime, my entire bank accounts balance is locked to me. Bank of America refused to issue me a credit, stating that these transactions would require my PIN number - something that I have never told anybody, but which could have been stolen in any manner of ways.

I have filed a police report regarding this issue, but this has not sped up the process whatsoever.

The fraudulent checks have a signature on them that purports to be mine, but is not my signature. Bank of America knows what my signature looks like, and chose not to verify it when cashing these checks. In addition, these checks were for a far higher balance than any normal transaction in my bank account. They failed to do their due diligence, and expect me to suffer while they take their time.

Bank of America constantly talks about how they protect the consumer from fraud, but when I needed their help after being a customer for 10 years, they told me that I just had to wait while they took their time to conduct an investigation. I am tired of waiting. I have received no new information for over two months, and I want action on this immediately.

They have even started sending me emails stating that I owe them money due to these fraudulent transactions.

When all the fraud is removed from my bank account, I should have a balance of {$950.00}. I want this money returned to me without delay.

issue: Advertising and marketing, including promotional offers
sub_issue: Didn't receive advertised or promotional terms
consumer_complaint_narrative:
Hello, I have a Chase XXXX XXXX Visa credit card that had a promotional offer stating if I made a purchase at a retailer, XXXX, I would receive 10 % cash back on my credit card, up to {$17.00}. I activated this offer, then proceeded to make a {$260.00} on XX/XX/2019 ( see Attachment 1 ). I checked online and was only credited {$9.00}. Chase stated because XXXX broke up my SINGLE transaction into two separate charges ( not sure why they processed this transaction this way, see Attachment 2 ), I was only eligible for {$9.00} instead of {$17.00}. I feel like this is an unfair business practice as the consumer does not control how the merchant processes and ultimately charges customers. I contacted Chase two times, and the first individual said they would refer my complaint to card services. I received notification via mail ( see Attachment 3 ), that I would only be credited {$9.00}. I offered to send my receipt to the credit card company and they did not care. They said I would need to contact XXXX. This offer was made to me through Chase, so I don't understand how XXXX would be responsible for crediting me the remaining {$8.00}. I feel that if this is a standard practice, there are likely other consumers that are also being treated unfairly after spending the required amounts of money to qualify for these offers. This seems like an unfair business practice. I upheld my end of the agreement, used this card for this reason, and was told I would not receive the promised amount. While the amount is arbitrary ( {$8.00} ), it's the practice that I feel is abusive, and as I mentioned earlier, other consumers are likely impacted by this practice. In aggregate, who knows -- XXXX has a large customer base and Chase is probably gaining a large amount of XXXX XXXX Credit Card holders through this relationship. If customers are not actively checking their accounts for credits, they would not know that they were losing money promised to them by the creditor. 

Thank You, XXXX XXXX
